item.content:encoded: The Philippines on Wednesday accused China Coast Guard of elevating tensions in the South China Sea after its use of water cannons that damaged two of its vessels, an official said.

item.title: SWS: Nationwide hunger rate up to 14.2%, Metro Manila hunger at worst with 19%
item.content:encoded:
Filipino families, involuntary hunger, Social Weather Stations poll, increased, 14.2%, Summary: The latest Social Weather Stations poll revealed that 14.2% of Filipino families experienced involuntary hunger, meaning they were hungry and did not have anything to eat. This increase in the number of families facing hunger highlights the ongoing challenges of food insecurity in the country. The rise in involuntary hunger underscores the need for more comprehensive and sustainable solutions to address the root causes of hunger and poverty in Filipino communities. As the government and various organizations work to provide assistance and support to vulnerable families, it is crucial to prioritize long-term solutions that promote food security and alleviate the impact of hunger on Filipino families. The findings of the poll serve as a stark reminder of the urgent need to address food insecurity and ensure access to nutritious food for all individuals and families in the Philippines.

Summary:

Filipino families who experienced involuntary hunger, meaning being hungry and not having anything to eat, increased to 14.2%, the latest Social Weather Stations poll showed.

item.title: Marcos orders review of minimum wage rates
item.content:encoded:
minimum wage rates, review, President Ferdinand ''Bongbong'' Marcos Jr., regions, call

President Ferdinand ''Bongbong'' Marcos Jr. called for a review of the minimum wage rates in every region. He emphasized the need to reassess the current rates to ensure that they are adequate and fair for workers in different areas. This move aims to address the disparity in wages across regions and promote a more equitable distribution of income. By conducting a comprehensive review, the government can better understand the economic conditions in each region and make informed decisions on setting minimum wage rates. President Marcos Jr.'s initiative reflects his commitment to supporting workers and promoting economic development throughout the country.

President Ferdinand ''Bongbong'' Marcos Jr. on Wednesday called for a review of the minimum wage rates in every region.

item.title: Workers mark Labor Day with calls for wage hike
item.content:encoded:
Workers, groups, protest, actions, wage hike
Summary: Workers' groups and organizations in Metro Manila staged protest actions on Labor Day to call for a wage hike. Several groups demanded an increase in salaries to address the rising cost of living and to provide better living conditions for workers. The protests called for a significant increase in the minimum wage to ensure workers have a decent standard of living and can support themselves and their families. The demonstrations highlighted the need for fair compensation and improved working conditions to address labor rights violations and ensure social justice for workers. The protests aimed to draw attention to the struggles faced by workers in the Philippines and to push for policies that prioritize the welfare and rights of laborers.

Several workers" groups and other organizations staged protest actions in Metro Manila on Labor Day on Wednesday to call for a wage hike.

item.title: Job-hopping Filipino GenZs on 4th or 5th gigs share why
item.content:encoded:
jobs, skills, resumes, youth, smartphone
Summary:
Elmer, a 26-year-old, has had five jobs and learned multiple skills in less than five years. Like many others in his age group, he keeps a collection of resumes on his smartphone for easy access to send out to potential employers. Elmer's ability to adapt and gain various skills highlights the traits of the younger working generation. With technology at his fingertips, he can easily apply for new opportunities and showcase his diverse skill set. This flexibility and eagerness to learn and grow are common among today's youth, who are constantly seeking new challenges and experiences in the workforce. Elmer's experience serves as an example of how young professionals navigate the modern job market with ease and adaptability.

In less than five years, 26-year-old Elmer has had five jobs, learned multiple skills, and like most working youth his age, kept a slew of resumes to be sent to the next potential workplace with a few taps of his smartphone keys.

item.title: Grassfire hits portion of Chocolate Hills in Bohol
item.content:encoded:
Chocolate Hills, Carmen, Bohol, grassfire, Unang Balita Summary: A grassfire has affected two hills of Chocolate Hills in Carmen, Bohol, as reported by Unang Balita. The fire has spread to these iconic landforms, causing potential damage to the natural environment. Authorities are working to contain the blaze and prevent further destruction to the hills and surrounding areas. The Chocolate Hills, a prominent tourist destination known for its unique conical hills, are at risk of being harmed by the ongoing fire. Immediate action is crucial to safeguard the biodiversity and beauty of this natural wonder in Bohol.

A grassfire has affected two hills of Chocolate Hills in Carmen, Bohol, Unang Balita reported on Wednesday.

item.title: Valenzuela City deploys mobile showers amid extreme heat
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: Valenzuela City, local government unit, mobile showers, water supply interruptions, hot weather Summary: The local government unit of Valenzuela City has responded to water supply interruptions during hot weather by deploying mobile showers to affected communities. This initiative aims to provide residents with access to clean and refreshing showers amidst the rising temperatures. The mobile showers serve as a temporary solution to help residents cope with the lack of water for personal hygiene and cooling off during the heatwave. By bringing essential services directly to the affected areas, the government hopes to alleviate the inconvenience and discomfort caused by the water supply disruptions. This proactive approach demonstrates the commitment of Valenzuela City's local authorities to address the needs of their constituents and support them during challenging circumstances.

Summary: The local government unit of Valenzuela City has deployed mobile showers to communities affected by water supply interruptions amid the hot weather. This initiative aims to provide residents with access to clean and refreshing showers, serving as a temporary solution to help them cope with the lack of water for personal hygiene and cooling off during the heatwave.

The local government unit of Valenzuela City has deployed mobile showers to communities affected by water supply interruptions amid the hot weather.

item.title: Ukrainian official discusses taken children with Vatican envoy
item.content:encoded: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy's chief of staff thanked a Vatican envoy on Tuesday for his efforts in trying to bring home thousands of children forcibly taken to Russia and asked him for help in returning prisoners of war.

item.title: Extreme heat is closing schools, widening learning gaps worldwide
item.content:encoded: As the climate warms due to the burning of fossil fuels, heatwaves are lasting longer and reaching greater peaks as average temperatures rise. In turn, government authorities and public health experts across the world are grappling with whether to keep students learning in hot classrooms, or encourage them to stay home and keep cool.

item.title: Houthis attack four ships in Indian Ocean, Red Sea
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: Yemen, Houthis, MSC Orion container ship, drone attack, solidarity, Palestinians, Israel, Gaza Summary: Yemen's Houthi rebels claimed responsibility for targeting the MSC Orion container ship in the Indian Ocean with a drone attack. The attack is part of their ongoing campaign against international shipping, carried out in solidarity with the Palestinians against Israel's military actions in Gaza. This latest incident underscores the volatile situation in the region and the Houthis' continued efforts to disrupt maritime traffic. The targeting of commercial vessels poses a significant risk to maritime security and highlights the challenges faced by the international community in ensuring safe passage through key shipping routes. The attack on the MSC Orion highlights the Houthis' willingness to use unconventional means to advance their agenda and draw attention to their cause. The incident serves as a reminder of the complex dynamics at play in the Middle East and the threat posed by armed groups operating in the region.

Summary:

Yemen's Houthis said on Tuesday they targeted the MSC Orion container ship in a drone attack in the Indian Ocean as part of their ongoing campaign against international shipping in solidarity with Palestinians against Israel's military actions in Gaza.

item.title: California's population grew in 2023 for first time since 2020
item.content:encoded:
Population, California, growth, mortality, immigration Summary: - The population of California increased for the first time since 2020. - The growth is attributed to a decrease in mortality rates. - Legal foreign immigration also rebounded, contributing to the population increase.

Summary:

The population of California grew last year for the first time since 2020, thanks to a drop in mortality and a rebound in legal foreign immigration, the state's Department of Finance said on Tuesday.

item.title: Mayor at vice mayor ng Tobias Fornier sa Antique, nagsuntukan dahil sa food packs ng DSWD
item.content:encoded:
Suntukan, Alkalde, Bise alkalde, Tobias Fornier, Antique Summary: The mayor and vice mayor of Tobias Fornier in Antique got into a physical altercation over the delivery of food packs from the Department of Social Welfare and Development (DSWD) for residents affected by El Niño. The argument stemmed from disagreements on how to distribute the food aid, leading to a heated confrontation that escalated into a fistfight. The incident highlighted tensions between local officials and raised concerns about the effective distribution of relief goods to those in need during times of crisis. The physical altercation between the mayor and vice mayor underscored the challenges faced by communities dealing with the impact of natural disasters and the importance of effective governance in times of crisis. The altercation also drew attention to the need for better coordination and communication among local officials to ensure the efficient delivery of relief assistance to vulnerable populations.

Nauwi sa suntukan ang pagtatalo ng alkalde at bise alkalde ng Tobias Fornier sa Antique dahil sa delivery ng food packs mula sa Department of Social Welfare and Development (DSWD) para umano sa mga residenteng apektado ng El Niño.

item.title: Fire hits warehouse, 2 factories in Guiguinto, Bulacan
item.content:encoded:
warehouse, fire, Barangay Tiaong, Guiguinto, Bulacan Summary: A fire broke out in a warehouse and two nearby factories located in Barangay Tiaong, Guiguinto, Bulacan, late afternoon on Tuesday. The incident was reported by EJ Gomez on "Saksi." The fire caused significant damage to the warehouse and nearby factories, resulting in a chaotic scene as firefighters rushed to extinguish the flames. The cause of the fire is currently unknown, and authorities are investigating the incident. No injuries have been reported at this time, but the extent of the damage is still being assessed. Residents in the area were advised to stay clear of the affected area due to the ongoing firefighting efforts. The fire serves as a reminder of the importance of fire safety measures in industrial settings to prevent such destructive incidents.

Summary:

A fire hit a warehouse and two nearby factories in Barangay Tiaong in Guiguinto, Bulacan late afternoon on Tuesday, according to the report of EJ Gomez on "Saksi."

item.title: 3 suspects arrested for allegedly killing, tying up, dragging a dog on a motorbike in Iligan City
item.content:encoded:
Arrested, Suspects, Killing, Dog, Motorbike
The two suspects have been arrested for allegedly killing a dog, tying it up, and dragging it while on a motorbike. Another companion surrendered to the police in connection with the incident. The suspects are currently in custody and will likely face charges related to animal cruelty. The dog's body was found with severe injuries, leading to a swift investigation by authorities. The brutal and senseless act has sparked outrage in the community, with many calling for justice to be served. It is important for law enforcement to take a strong stance against such despicable acts of cruelty towards animals. The cooperation of the public is crucial in ensuring that all parties involved are held accountable for their actions.

Summary: The two suspects have been arrested for allegedly killing, tying up, and dragging a dog while on a motorbike. Another companion surrendered to the police in connection with the incident. The suspects are currently in custody and will likely face charges related to animal cruelty. The dog's body was found with severe injuries, leading to a swift investigation by authorities. The brutal and senseless act has sparked outrage in the community.

The two suspects have been arrested while another companion surrendered to the police for allegedly killing, tying up, and dragging a dog while on a motorbike.

item.title: Lightning strikes wedding reception in Davao City, 7 hurt
item.content:encoded:
lightning, wedding reception, Barangay Salaysay, Marilog District, Davao City Summary: Seven people were injured during a wedding reception in Barangay Salaysay, Marilog District, Davao City, after lightning struck the venue. The incident caused chaos and panic among the guests as they scrambled for safety. Emergency services were called to the scene to tend to the injured individuals. The victims were immediately taken to the hospital for medical treatment. The incident serves as a reminder of the dangers of lightning strikes and the importance of being prepared for such emergencies.

At least seven people were injured after lightning struck the venue of a wedding reception held in Barangay Salaysay, Marilog District in Davao City, according to a report on "Saksi."

item.title: Mayora ng Daly City, California, proud sa kaniyang Pinoy heritage
item.content:encoded: Kahit isinilang at lumaki sa California, USA, proud sa kaniyang Pinoy heritage si Juslyn C. Manalo, ang kauna-unahang Fil-Am na babaeng mayor ng Daly City.

item.content:encoded: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said that if the ICC issues arrest warrants related to the conduct of Israel in Gaza it would be a scandal on a historic scale.

item.title: Nations express concern over China water cannon assault on PCG ship
item.content:encoded:
Philippines Coast Guard, China Coast Guard, West Philippine Sea, water cannons, concern
Summary: Several countries expressed concern after China Coast Guard ships aimed water cannons at a Philippines Coast Guard vessel in the West Philippine Sea. The action was deemed dangerous and provoked condemnation from various nations. The use of water cannons in a military confrontation heightened tensions in the already volatile region. The incident highlighted the longstanding territorial disputes in the West Philippine Sea and raised international scrutiny on China's actions in the area. The aggressive behavior of the China Coast Guard was met with criticism and calls for restraint to prevent escalation of conflict in the region.

Several countries on Tuesday expressed concern after ships of the China Coast Guard trained water cannons on a Philippine Coast Guard vessel in the West Philippine Sea earlier in the day, calling the action "dangerous."

item.title: DepEd seeks to hire 5K admin personnel
item.content:encoded:
Department of Education, DepEd, hire, personnel, administrative tasks

The Department of Education, known as DepEd, is planning to hire 5,000 additional staff to assist teachers in easing their workload by taking over administrative responsibilities. This initiative aims to enhance the efficiency of the education system by allowing teachers to focus more on teaching and improving student learning outcomes. By delegating administrative tasks such as paperwork, record-keeping, and other non-teaching duties to the new personnel, schools can become more productive and provide better support to students. The move is part of DepEd's efforts to address the work overload faced by teachers and create a more conducive and conducive work environment in schools. The recruitment of additional personnel will enable teachers to dedicate more time and energy to lesson planning, implementing creative teaching methods, and giving individual attention to students. Overall, this strategy is expected to enhance the quality of education and ensure a more fulfilling teaching experience for educators.

Summary: The Department of Education, or DepEd, is planning to hire 5,000 personnel to assist teachers and reduce their administrative workload. This initiative aims to improve the efficiency of the education system and allow teachers to focus more on teaching and enhancing student learning outcomes.

The Department of Education (DepEd) wants to hire at least 5,000 personnel to help unburden the teachers with the administrative tasks they are currently doing.

item.title: Romualdez, gustong magbenta muli ng murang bigas ang NFA; Rice Tariff law, aamyendahan
item.content:encoded:
amend, Rice Tariffication law, National Food Authority, sell, cheap
Summary:
Speaker Martin Romualdez announced that the House of Representatives will amend the Rice Tariffication law (RTL) to allow the National Food Authority (NFA) to sell cheap rice again.

Inihayag ni Speaker Martin Romualdez na aamyendahan ng Kamara de Representantes ang Rice Tariffication law (RTL) para payagan ang National Food Authority (NFA) na magbenta muli ng murang bigas.

item.title: Tropa ng mga pusa, nag-'bayanihan" sa pag-raid ng ref ng kanilang fur mom

item.title: Austria"s Beer Party, seeing glass half-full, runs for parliament
item.content:encoded: The party, founded largely as a joke in 2015 by medical doctor and rock musician Dominik Wlazny, now poses a real threat of siphoning off votes from other parties.

item.title: Mayor, vice mayor come to blows over truck of food packs in Antique
item.content:encoded: The mayor and vice mayor of Tobias Fornier in Antique were caught on video apparently fighting over a truck of food packs meant for residents affected by El Niño.

item.title: Manila court gives former drug offenders livelihood packages
item.content:encoded: Giving a helping hand as they seek a fresh start in life outside of prison, a Manila court has provided former drug offenders with food carts as business ventures for their reintegration in society.

item.title: ICC war crimes prosecutors interviewing Gaza hospital staff, sources say
item.content:encoded: International Criminal Court prosecutors have interviewed staff from Gaza's two biggest hospitals--high-profile targets that were surrounded, besieged and stormed by Israeli forces.

item.title: Suspect nabbed for blackmail, posting ex's sensitive photos, videos
item.content:encoded:
Philippine National Police, Anti-Cybercrime Group, suspect, sensitive photos, social media

The Anti-Cybercrime Group of the Philippine National Police apprehended a suspect who had reportedly posted intimate photos and videos of his former 18-year-old partner on various social media platforms. The suspect's actions violated cybercrime laws, which prohibit the dissemination of unauthorized, private content online. The victim's privacy rights were violated, leading to emotional distress and public exposure without consent. The suspect's arrest serves as a warning to individuals engaging in similar malicious activities that the authorities are actively monitoring and enforcing cyber laws to protect citizens from online exploitation. The incident also highlights the importance of respecting one's partner's privacy and the potential legal consequences of violating cyber laws. It is crucial for netizens to be vigilant and responsible in their online activities to prevent cybercrimes and protect individuals' rights to privacy.

Summary:

The Anti-Cybercrime Group of the Philippine National Police arrested a suspect who allegedly posted sensitive photos and videos of his 18-year-old ex-girlfriend on social media.

item.title: Dead whale found in Romblon waters
item.content:encoded:
whale, Sitio Atabay, Ferrol, Romblon, 2-meter-long, 120 kilos Summary: A 2-meter-long whale, weighing 120 kilos, washed ashore at Sitio Atabay in Ferrol, Romblon. The massive marine creature's presence caused a stir among locals, attracting onlookers who gathered to catch a glimpse of the unusual sight. Authorities were alerted and quickly mobilized to investigate the situation and determine the cause of the washed-up whale. Efforts were made to assess the condition of the whale and to devise a plan to remove it from the shore. The community came together to support the authorities in their endeavor to handle the situation and ensure the proper handling of the whale. Despite the sad circumstances surrounding the stranded whale, the event served as a reminder of the importance of marine conservation and the need to protect and preserve the ocean's inhabitants. It also highlighted the interconnectedness between humans and marine life and emphasized the responsibility we have to safeguard the environment for future generations.

Summary:

A two-meter-long whale weighing 120 kilos washed ashore at Sitio Atabay in Ferrol, Romblon.

item.title: One winner bags P103 million in Ultra Lotto 6/58
item.content:encoded:
winner, jackpot prize, Ultra Lotto 6/58 draw, P103 million, April 30 Summary: A lone winner clinched the Ultra Lotto 6/58 jackpot prize worth over P103 million on Tuesday night, April 30.

A lone winner has bagged the jackpot prize of over P103 million in the Ultra Lotto 6/58 draw on April 30, Tuesday night.

item.title: EU drug watchdog urges COVID-19 vaccine update
item.content:encoded: The EU's drug watchdog urged that anti-COVID-19 jabs be updated before another round of vaccinations to counter a new variant of the virus, which is still claiming thousands of lives.

item.content:encoded: The Philippine Navy on Tuesday said that aside from a Chinese research vessel in the waters of Catanduanes, three more survey ships were spotted in Ayungin Shoal in the West Philippine Sea.

item.title: Babae, pinipilit na makipag-'threesome' para 'di ipakalat ang pribado niyang pics, videos
item.content:encoded: Nasakote ng mga awtoridad sa Naga City, Camarines Sur ang dalawang lalaki na nanakot umano sa isang 27-anyos na babae na ipakakalat ang kaniyang mga pribadong larawan at videos kapag hindi pumayag sa kanilang gusto-- ang pagtatalik ng "threesome."

item.title: Babaeng ikinadena sa dahil sa problema sa pag-iisip, malaki na ang ipinagbago mula nang sagipin
item.content:encoded:
chains, naked, outside, rescued, mental health

Rescued and treated for her mental health issues, a 22-year-old woman was featured on "Kapuso Mo, Jessica Soho" after being found chained, naked, and outside her home exposed to the heat and rain. In just a few months, she has shown significant improvement in her condition following her rescue and treatment. This story highlights the importance of mental health awareness and the impact it can have on individuals. It serves as a reminder of the need for support and understanding for those struggling with mental health issues. The woman's transformation showcases the positive outcomes that can result from proper intervention and care. Her journey is a testament to the resilience and strength of the human spirit in overcoming challenges and adversity. The attention brought to her story sheds light on the complexities of mental health and the significance of providing help and resources to those in need. Overall, this narrative underscores the importance of empathy, compassion, and advocacy in addressing mental health concerns within society. Summary: - Rescued and treated for mental health issues - Found chained, naked, and outside her home - Significant improvement in her condition - Importance of mental health awareness and support - Transformation showcases positive outcomes from proper intervention and care

Nakakadena, hubo't hubad, at nasa labas ng bahay na lantad sa init at ulan nang unang maitampok sa "Kapuso Mo, Jessica Soho" ang isang 22-anyos na babae na may problema sa pag-iisip. Ilan buwan pa lang mula nang sagipin siya at ipagamot, malaki na ang kaniyang naging pagbabago.

item.title: DICT finds over 30,000 vulnerabilities in govt digital assets
item.content:encoded:
vulnerabilities, government, digital assets, DICT, detected Summary:
The Department of Information and Communications Technology (DICT) identified over 30,000 vulnerabilities in 2,002 government digital assets. These vulnerabilities pose potential risks to the security and integrity of government systems. The DICT has taken proactive measures to address these vulnerabilities and enhance the cybersecurity of government digital assets. The detection of such a significant number of vulnerabilities highlights the importance of regularly assessing and securing digital networks and systems within government agencies. The DICT's efforts to identify and mitigate these vulnerabilities demonstrate a commitment to safeguarding sensitive information and ensuring the reliability of government services.

The Department of Information and Communications Technology (DICT) said on Tuesday it detected over 30,000 vulnerabilities in 2,002 government digital assets.

item.title: 2 pulis na nangotong at nanggulo umano sa peryahan sa Zamboanga del Norte, inalis sa puwesto
item.content:encoded:
Corrupt, Policemen, Extortion, Peryahan, Zamboanga del Norte Summary: Two policemen were removed from their positions due to their involvement in extortion and causing trouble at a local peryahan in Zamboanga del Norte. The policemen were allegedly frequenting the area to demand money from the vendors. Their actions led to their dismissal from their roles within the police force. This incident highlights the issue of corruption within law enforcement and the negative impact it can have on local communities. It is crucial for authorities to address and prevent such misconduct among officers to maintain trust and integrity in the police force.

Inalis sa puwesto ang dalawang pulis na bukod sa nangongotong na, nanggulo pa umano sa isang peryahan sa Zamboanga del Norte. Madalas daw na magtungo sa lugar ang mga pulis para manghingi ng pera.

item.title: Gunmen kill at least 5 in attack on mosque in Afghanistan
item.content:encoded: Gunmen attacked a mosque in western Afghanistan on Monday night during prayer time, killing at least five people, a spokesperson for the provincial governor said.

item.title: Pagsagip sa sanggol na nasa bubungan, makapigil-hininga

item.title: PDEA insists leaked docs linking Marcos to drugs non-existent
item.content:encoded: Philippine Drug Enforcement Agency (PDEA) Director General Moro Virgilio Lazo insisted Tuesday that the supposed pre-operation report and authority to operate which both circulated on social media are non-existent.

item.title: Mexico tells World Court Ecuador embassy raid was illegal
item.content:encoded: Mexico told judges at the International Court of Justice (ICJ) on Tuesday that an armed raid on its embassy in Quito by Ecuador breached international law.

item.title: Ex-president Duterte, Sotto, Tulfo top potential senatorial bets in survey
item.content:encoded: Former president Rodrigo Duterte, former senator Tito Sotto, and Partylist Representative Erwin Tulfo topped a recent senatorial survey conducted by Oculum Research and Analytics.

item.title: Bill banning broadcast, publication of images of crime, suicide victims filed
item.content:encoded:
proposed, House of Representatives, bill, broadcast, publication Summary:

A bill has been proposed at the House of Representatives to prohibit the broadcast and publication of images and information of crime, accident, and suicide victims. This legislation aims to protect the privacy and dignity of individuals who have been victims of such incidents. If passed, the bill would prevent media outlets from exploiting and sensationalizing sensitive and distressing content for public consumption. Supporters of the bill argue that it is necessary to prevent further trauma and harm to the families and loved ones of victims. However, opponents of the bill raise concerns about potential limitations on freedom of the press and access to information. The proposal has sparked a debate about the balance between the right to privacy and the public's right to know about important events happening in society.

A bill prohibiting the broadcast and publication of images and information of crime,accident, and suicide victims was proposed at the House of Representatives.

item.title: London police arrest sword-wielding man after reports of stabbing
item.content:encoded:
arrested, man, sword, stabbed, incident Summary: The British police have arrested a man armed with a sword in northeast London following reports of people being stabbed in a serious incident. The man was apprehended as police responded to the scene. The incident took place in the capital, and the police force responded promptly to the reports. The man was found with a sword, which was believed to have been used in the stabbings. The police are currently investigating the incident to determine the details of what occurred and the motive behind the attacks. The swift action of the police led to the suspect's arrest and prevented further harm to the public. The situation is currently under control, and the authorities are working to ensure the safety of the community. The man's arrest marks a significant development in the case, and more information is expected to be released as the investigation progresses. The police are urging anyone with information about the incident to come forward to aid in the investigation.

Summary:

British police have arrested a man armed with a sword following reports of people having been stabbed during a serious incident in northeast London, the capital's police force said.

item.title: Marcos wants lower electric vehicle production cost
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: President Ferdinand "Bongbong" Marcos Jr., DOE, electric vehicles, production cost, focus Summary: President Ferdinand "Bongbong" Marcos Jr. has instructed the DOE and other relevant agencies to concentrate on reducing the production expense of electric vehicles. This effort aims to make electric vehicles more accessible to the public by lowering their cost. By focusing on cost efficiency, the government hopes to incentivize more people to switch to electric vehicles, thereby reducing carbon emissions and promoting sustainability in the transportation sector. This move aligns with the government's commitment to promoting renewable energy sources and reducing the country's carbon footprint. The initiative also highlights the importance of sustainable transportation solutions in addressing environmental concerns and promoting a cleaner, greener future for the Philippines.

Summary: President Ferdinand "Bongbong" Marcos Jr. has directed the DOE and other agencies to prioritize reducing the production cost of electric vehicles to enhance their affordability and encourage their adoption. This initiative supports the government's efforts to promote sustainable transportation solutions and reduce carbon emissions in the country.

President Ferdinand ''Bongbong'' Marcos Jr. ordered the DOE and other concerned agencies to focus on finding ways to lower the production cost of electric vehicles.

item.title: China warships violated NOTAM during PH-US-France WPS exercise --Balikatan exec
item.content:encoded: The Chinese warships spotted during the maritime exercise of the naval forces of the Philippines, United States, and France in the West Philippine Sea (WPS) have violated the notice to mariners (NOTAM), a Balikatan official said.

item.title: Mga barko ng PCG at BFAR, binomba na rin ng tubig ng China Coast Guard malapit sa Scarborough Shoal
item.content:encoded: Binomba na rin ng tubig ng China Coast Guard (CCG) vessels ang mga barko ng Philippine Coast Guard (PCG) at Bureau of Fisheries and Aquatic Resources (BFAR) na patungo sa Scarborough (Panatag) Shoal sa West Philippine Sea (WPS) para sa supply mission.

item.title: Bell-Kenz denies multi-level marketing, admits incentives to doctors
item.content:encoded:
incentives, doctors, involvement, denied, multi-level marketing

Bell-Kenz Pharma Inc. has denied any involvement in a multi-level marketing scheme but has acknowledged providing incentives to doctors. The company maintains that these incentives are a common practice within the pharmaceutical industry and are given in accordance with ethical guidelines. Despite their denial of participating in a multi-level marketing scheme, Bell-Kenz Pharma Inc. may still face scrutiny for their incentivizing practices. While providing incentives to doctors is not illegal, it can raise questions about the potential influence on prescribing practices and patient care. It is important for pharmaceutical companies to be transparent about their relationships with healthcare providers to ensure that patient well-being remains the top priority. Additionally, it is crucial for regulatory bodies to closely monitor these practices to prevent any unethical conduct within the industry.

Summary:

Bell-Kenz Pharma Inc.denied involvement in a multi-level marketing scheme but admitted that it provided incentives to doctors.

item.title: PCG wants entry ports for foreign private yacht to prevent entry of illegal drugs
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: Philippine Coast Guard, entry ports, foreign private yachts, illegal drugs, proposal Summary: The Philippine Coast Guard (PCG) has proposed the establishment of specific entry ports for foreign private yachts as a preventive measure against the entry of illegal drugs into the country. By creating designated entry points, the PCG aims to enhance their ability to monitor and inspect incoming vessels and deter potential smuggling activities. This initiative is part of the broader efforts to strengthen maritime security and protect the Philippines from the threat of drug trafficking. The PCG's proposal underscores the importance of proactive measures in combating illegal drug activities through targeted interventions at entry points for foreign yachts. By implementing this strategy, the PCG seeks to safeguard the country's borders and disrupt illicit drug networks that may exploit maritime routes for illegal activities.

Summary:

PCG wants entry ports for foreign privaThe Philippine Coast Guard (PCG) on Tuesday proposed the creation of entry ports for foreign private yachts to prevent the entry of illegal drugs into the country.te yacht to prevent entry of illegal drugs

item.title: Kotse, tumaob sa Commonwealth Avenue nang makatulog umano ang driver na papasok sa trabaho
item.content:encoded:
kotse, Commonwealth Avenue, Quezon City, tumaob, driver
Summary: A car overturned on Commonwealth Avenue in Quezon City after the driver allegedly fell asleep on the way to work. The driver lost control of the vehicle, resulting in the accident. Fortunately, no one was injured in the incident. The car sustained significant damage and had to be towed away from the scene. The driver admitted to dozing off while driving, emphasizing the importance of staying alert behind the wheel. It serves as a reminder for motorists to prioritize road safety and take necessary precautions to prevent accidents caused by drowsy driving.

Summary:

Tumaob ang isang kotse sa Commonwealth Avenue sa Quezon City matapos makatulog umano ang driver nito na papasok sa trabaho.

item.title: DepEd issues policy on 'overload pay' for public school teachers
item.content:encoded: DepEd rationalizes public school teachers" workload to allow them to have more classroom time.

item.content:encoded: President Ferdinand ''Bongbong'' Marcos Jr. wants 10 percent of government service vehicles to be electric powered, Energy Undersecretary Felix William Fuentebella said on Tuesday.

item.title: Indonesia may offer dual citizenship to attract overseas workers, minister says
item.content:encoded: Indonesia may offer dual citizenship to people of Indonesian descent to entice more skilled workers into the country, a senior cabinet minister said on Tuesday.

item.title: DepEd proposes ending School Year 2024-2025 in March
item.content:encoded: The Department of Education (DepEd) on Tuesday said it has proposed to President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. ending the School Year 2024-2025 in March 2025 amid clamor for the immediate return to the April-May school break.

item.title: 'Oratio Imperata' sought against El Niño, ill effects

item.content:encoded: Lanao del Norte First District Representative Khalid Dimaporo said on Tuesday that he hoped that senators would vote on the Charter change measure before the 2025 midterm polls.

item.title: Residents of northern Israel brace for possible all-out war with Hezbollah
item.content:encoded: Israel and Hezbollah have been engaged in escalating daily cross-border strikes over the past six months and their increasing range and sophistication has spurred fears of a wider regional conflict.

item.title: Chinese research ship in east PH dropped equipment in Catanduanes
item.content:encoded: The Chinese research vessel recently spotted in the east of the Philippines was showing erratic behavior and was caught lowering an equipment near Catanduanes, the Philippine Navy said Tuesday.

item.title: DOH reports 67 heat-related illnesses for school-aged individuals
item.content:encoded: As rising temperatures affect the country, the Department of Health on Tuesday said it recorded 67 cases of heat-related illnesses among individuals aged 12 years old to 21 years old.

item.title: Indonesia's Ruang volcano erupts again, alert status at highest
item.content:encoded:
volcano, eruption, Indonesia, alert status, airport
Summary:
Ruang volcano in Indonesia erupted, spewing explosive flows of lava and lighting up the night sky with dramatic lightning flashes. As a result, authorities raised the alert status and closed a nearby airport. The eruption was intense, with incandescent lava shooting into the air, creating a spectacle for onlookers. The volcano's crater was illuminated by the bursts of lava and lightning, adding to the dramatic scene. The closure of the airport was a precautionary measure to ensure the safety of people in the vicinity. The eruption serves as a reminder of the active volcanic activity in Indonesia and the need for constant monitoring and preparedness.

Indonesia's Ruang volcano spewed "explosive" flows of incandescent lava into the night sky on Tuesday as lightning flashes dramatically lit up its crater, prompting authorities to raise the alert status and close a nearby airport.

item.title: Cat accidentally shipped to online retailer in US
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: curious cat, open box, shipped, Amazon warehouse, sealed inside
Summary:
A curious cat managed to sneak into an open box, which was then sealed by its unknowing owners. The box was subsequently shipped across the United States to an Amazon warehouse. The feline's unexpected journey highlights the importance of ensuring boxes are securely closed before mailing them. The cat's owners were likely surprised to discover their pet had gone missing and inadvertently ended up in a warehouse far from home. Fortunately, the cat was eventually found unharmed and returned to its owners, providing a happy ending to what could have been a potentially dangerous situation for the adventurous pet. This incident serves as a reminder for pet owners to always check their surroundings before sealing boxes or packages to prevent similar mishaps in the future.
Summary:

A curious cat that sneaked into an open box was shipped across the United States to an Amazon warehouse after its unknowing owners sealed it inside.

item.title: 3 Chinese research vessels spotted in Ayungin Shoal -- PH Navy
item.content:encoded:
Chinese, research vessels, Ayungin Shoal, West Philippine Sea, Philippine Navy Summary: Three Chinese research vessels were recently observed in Ayungin Shoal, located in the West Philippine Sea, by the Philippine Navy. This area, also known as Second Thomas Shoal, is a disputed territory in the WPS. The presence of the Chinese vessels raises concerns over potential incursions and encroachments in the region by China, which has been asserting its claims in the contested waters. The Philippine Navy's monitoring of the situation highlights the ongoing tensions and maritime disputes in the WPS, where multiple countries have overlapping territorial claims. The incident underscores the need for continued vigilance and diplomatic efforts to address territorial disputes and ensure freedom of navigation in the region. The presence of Chinese research vessels in Ayungin Shoal adds another layer of complexity to the already contentious maritime situation in the WPS.

Summary:

Three Chinese research vessels were spotted in Ayungin Shoal in the West Philippine Sea (WPS) on Thursday, according to the Philippine Navy on Tuesday.

item.title: A 98-year-old Ukraine woman walks 10 km under shelling to escape Russians
item.content:encoded: A 98-year-old Ukrainian woman said she walked 10 kilometers under shelling, supporting herself with sticks and sleeping on the ground, leaving Ocheretyne in Donetsk, now occupied by Russia, and trying to reach areas controlled by Kyiv.

item.title: Marcos orders speedy enforcement of strategies to develop e-vehicle industry
item.content:encoded: On the application deadline for the consolidation of individual public utility vehicle (PUV) operators and drivers, President Ferdinand "Bongbong" Marcos Jr. directed Tuesday the Department of Energy (DOE) and other agencies to expedite the enforcement of strategies to develop the electric vehicle industry.

item.title: 3 patay, 17 sugatan sa karambola ng mga sasakyan sa Fairview, QC
item.content:encoded: Tatlo ang patay habang 17 ang sugatan matapos magkarambola ang mga sasakyan sa Fairview, Quezon City.

item.title: Zamboanga City mulls cloud seeding ops over watershed
item.content:encoded: The local government of Zamboanga City is set to conduct cloud seeding operation over the Zamboanga City watershed to address the problem on low water supply.

item.title: China Coast Guard fires water cannons at PH vessels near Scarborough Shoal
item.content:encoded:
Philippine, China, Coast Guard, vessels, water cannons Summary: China Coast Guard vessels used water cannons to intercept Philippine civilian vessels heading to Scarborough Shoal for a supply mission in the West Philippine Sea. The incident escalated tensions between the two countries over territorial disputes in the area. The Philippine vessels were en route to provide supplies to Filipino fishermen when they were met with resistance from the Chinese Coast Guard. The use of water cannons by China has raised concerns about the safety of the Filipino crew and the potential for further confrontations. This latest action highlights the ongoing maritime dispute between the Philippines and China in the region, specifically concerning Scarborough Shoal, which has been a point of contention for both countries in recent years.

China Coast Guard vessels on Tuesday fired water cannons at Philippine civilian vessels en route to Scarborough (Panatag) Shoal in the West Philippine Sea for a supply mission.

item.title: Brownouts hit Bacolod as power cables, transformers damaged by heat
item.content:encoded:
brownouts, Bacolod City, power cables, transformers, hot weather Summary: Residents of Bacolod City experienced brownouts this weekend due to damage caused by the hot weather to power cables, transformers, insulators, and fuses of electric posts. The extreme heat led to the deterioration of these essential electrical components, resulting in disruptions to the city's power supply. As a result, residents were impacted by intermittent power outages, highlighting the vulnerability of the infrastructure to weather-related incidents. The damaged power cables, transformers, insulators, and fuses needed repairs to restore the electricity supply to the affected areas. This situation serves as a reminder of the importance of maintaining and upgrading the electrical infrastructure to withstand such extreme weather conditions and ensure reliable power distribution to the city's residents.

Residents of Bacolod City experienced brownouts this weekend after power cables, transformers, insulators and fuses of electric posts were damaged by the hot weather.

item.title: Number coding suspended on May 1 --MMDA
item.content:encoded:
Metropolitan Manila Development Authority, expanded number coding scheme, suspended, Wednesday, MMDA

The Metropolitan Manila Development Authority announced on Tuesday that the expanded number coding scheme will be suspended starting on Wednesday. This decision was made in response to certain concerns and issues that arose with the implementation of the scheme. The MMDA aims to address these issues and ensure a smoother flow of traffic in Metropolitan Manila. The suspension of the expanded number coding scheme will provide relief to motorists and commuters who have been affected by the scheme. It is important for the MMDA to assess the effectiveness of the scheme and make necessary adjustments before it is reinstated. This temporary suspension highlights the MMDA's commitment to improving traffic management and addressing the needs of the public.

Summary:
Expanded number coding scheme suspended by MMDA on Wednesday to address concerns and improve traffic flow in Metropolitan Manila. Decision aims to provide relief to affected motorists and commuters, with a focus on assessing effectiveness and making necessary adjustments before reinstatement. MMDA's commitment to enhancing traffic management and addressing public needs emphasized through temporary suspension.

The expanded number coding scheme will be suspended on Wednesday, the Metropolitan Manila Development Authority said Tuesday.

item.title: DOLE to hold job fair in over 90 areas
item.content:encoded: DOLE will hold a job fair in 97 areas nationwide on Wednesday, May 1, 2024

item.title: Marcos urges intellectual property champions to maximize science, technology for PH
item.content:encoded: President Ferdinand ''Bongbong'' Marcos Jr. has called on Filipino innovators to maximize the “transformative power” of science and technology to attain an inclusive and sustainable Bagong Pilipinas.

item.title: 4-day work week prerogative of company -- DOLE
item.content:encoded: Amid the scorching heat being experienced in some parts of the country, the Department of Labor and Employment (DOLE) on Tuesday said that setting a four-day work week is the prerogative of a company.

item.title: UPLB respects CA decision on halting release of modified eggplant
item.content:encoded:
University of the Philippines, Los Baños; respects ruling; Court of Appeals; stop release; genetically modified eggplant
Summary:
The University of the Philippines - Los Baños has stated its compliance with the Court of Appeals' decision to halt the distribution of its genetically modified eggplant. The university acknowledges and abides by the order to cease the release of the controversial product.

The University of the Philippines - Los Baños has said that it respects the ruling of the Court of Appeals ordering the university to stop the release of its genetically modified eggplant product.

item.title: Transport strike vs PUV modernization marks 2nd day amid consolidation deadline
item.content:encoded:
Protest, Jeepney drivers, government, PUV Modernization Program, deadline

Summary: Jeepney drivers are protesting against the government's PUV Modernization Program for the second consecutive day on April 30, 2024, which was the deadline for them to consolidate under the program. The drivers are voicing their discontent with the program, which aims to modernize public utility vehicles in the Philippines. They argue that the program is financially burdensome and could lead to the displacement of traditional jeepney operators. Despite the deadline, the drivers are standing firm in their protest and are calling for a reconsideration of the program. The government faces pressure to address the concerns of the drivers and find a resolution that is acceptable to all parties involved.

Jeepney drivers continued their protest against the government"s PUV Modernization Program for the second day on April 30, 2024, the deadline given to them to consolidate as part of the program.

item.title: King Charles III resumes public duties as he fights cancer
item.content:encoded:
diagnosed, cancer, treatment, progress, public appearance Summary: King Charles III made his first official public appearance since being diagnosed with cancer. His doctors were "very encouraged" by the progress of his treatment, leading to his decision to attend the event. This public appearance marks an important milestone in the king's battle against cancer and demonstrates his determination to continue fulfilling his duties despite the challenges he faces. The positive update from his medical team has provided hope and reassurance to the public, who have been eagerly awaiting news of his health. King Charles III's presence at the event serves as a symbol of strength and resilience, inspiring others to remain optimistic in the face of adversity. The king's commitment to his royal responsibilities remains unwavering as he navigates through his treatment, setting an example for others facing similar health struggles. Overall, his public appearance is a testament to his courage and determination in the fight against cancer.

Summary:

King Charles III on Tuesday makes his first official public appearance since being diagnosed with cancer, after doctors said they were "very encouraged" by the progress of his treatment.

item.title: 3 dead, 17 hurt in Fairview, QC multi-vehicle accident
item.content:encoded: Three persons died while 17 others were injured in an accident involving several vehicles in Fairview, Quezon City on Monday night.

item.title: Luzon, Visayas grids on yellow alert on Tuesday
item.content:encoded: The Luzon and Visayas grids will be placed on yellow alert again on Tuesday, the NGCP said in separate advisories.

item.title: Provincial bus, inararo ang mga barrier sa EDSA; pasahero, nasaktan
item.content:encoded: Inararo ng isang provincial bus ang ilang concrete barrier sa EDSA Santolan sa Quezon City nitong Martes. Isang pasahero ang naiulat na nasaktan.

item.title: Unconsolidated PUV franchises to be revoked 'a week or two' after April 30 deadline --DOTr
item.content:encoded: Unconsolidated operators and drivers will be notified that their franchises are revoked “a week or two” after the April 30, 2024 consolidation deadline, a DOTr official said Tuesday.

item.title: Lalaking nanaksak ng pasahero sa Cagayan de Oro, arestado
item.content:encoded:
arrest, man, stab, woman, passenger Summary: A man was arrested in Cagayan de Oro City for allegedly stabbing a female passenger. The incident took place in public, causing alarm and a swift response from authorities. The victim was rushed to the hospital for treatment, and the suspect was apprehended shortly after the attack. The motive behind the stabbing remains unclear, as authorities investigate the case further to uncover the reasons behind this violent act. Such acts of violence are concerning and highlight the importance of ensuring public safety and security measures are in place to prevent similar incidents from occurring in the future. The quick response by law enforcement in arresting the suspect demonstrates the commitment to holding individuals accountable for their actions and ensuring justice is served for the victim.

Arestado ang isang lalaki matapos saksakin umano ang isang babaeng pasahero sa Cagayan de Oro City.

item.title: 5 Dawlah Islamiyah-Maute members killed in Lanao del Norte clashes --military
item.content:encoded:
encounters, government troops, Lanao del Norte, Islamiyah-Maute Group, members Summary:

Five members of the Dawlah Islamiyah-Maute Group were killed in two separate encounters with government troops in Lanao del Norte early Monday morning. The military confirmed the deaths of the militants in the clashes, which took place in the northern part of the province. The encounters occurred as part of the ongoing efforts by security forces to eliminate terrorist threats in the region. This operation was a success in neutralizing these five members of the extremist group, helping to prevent further violence and instability in the area. The military remains committed to maintaining peace and security in Lanao del Norte and will continue to target and eliminate terrorist elements in the region.

Five Dawlah Islamiyah-Maute Group members were killed in two subsequent encounters with government troops in Lanao del Norte early Monday morning, the military said.

item.title: Mga barko ng Tsina namataan habang sa gunnery exercise ng Balikatan
item.content:encoded:
barko, China, West Philippine Sea, sabayang paglayag, gunnery exercise Summary: Amid the joint naval exercises conducted by the Philippines, the United States, and France in the West Philippine Sea, multiple Chinese ships were spotted in the area. The coordinated efforts of the three countries aimed to enhance maritime security and interoperability. The presence of China's ships sparked concern and highlighted the ongoing territorial disputes in the region. Despite diplomatic tensions, the joint exercises proceeded as scheduled, demonstrating a show of force and unity among the participating nations. The sightings of Chinese vessels served as a reminder of the complex geopolitical landscape in the West Philippine Sea and the importance of upholding international laws and agreements. The incident underscored the ongoing challenges and competing interests in the region, underscoring the need for continued dialogue and cooperation to ensure peace and stability in the area.

Ilang barko ng China ang namataan sa West Philippine Sea kasabay ng sabayang paglayag at gunnery exercise ng Pilipinas, Amerika, at Pransiya.

item.title: Columbia threatens to suspend pro-Palestinian protesters after talks fail
item.content:encoded:
Columbia University, president, pro-Palestinian protesters, dismantling, encampment

Columbia University's president announced that discussions with pro-Palestinian demonstrators concerning the removal of their encampment did not result in an agreement. He emphasized the need for them to disband or face potential suspension. This decision follows the ongoing tensions between the university administration and the protesters over the encampment's presence on campus. Despite efforts to find a peaceful resolution, the discussions did not yield a satisfactory outcome. The president's statement serves as a warning to the protesters to comply with the university's directives or face consequences. It underscores the importance of maintaining order and adherence to campus regulations. The failure of the talks highlights the persistence of the issue and the challenges in reaching a compromise between the university and the protesters. The president's firm stance indicates the administration's commitment to upholding campus policies and defending the institution's integrity.

Summary: Columbia University's president addressed the unsuccessful negotiations with pro-Palestinian protesters regarding the dismantling of their encampment, warning them of potential consequences for non-compliance. Despite efforts to resolve the situation peacefully, the discussions did not lead to an agreement, underscoring the ongoing tensions between the parties. The statement emphasizes the importance of maintaining order on campus and adherence to university regulations. The president's firm stance signals the administration's dedication to upholding institutional policies and safeguarding the campus environment.

Columbia University's president said that talks with pro-Palestinian protesters over the dismantling of an encampment had failed and urged them to disperse or face suspension.

item.title: 1 dead after car collides with SUV in Ilocos Norte
item.content:encoded:
driver, car, SUV, collision, death Summary: A tragic incident occurred in Batac, Ilocos Norte, where a car driver lost his life following a fatal head-on collision with a sports utility vehicle (SUV). The collision resulted in the tragic death of the car's driver. The accident is a stark reminder of the potential dangers of road travel and the importance of adhering to traffic regulations. Authorities are likely conducting investigations to determine the cause of the collision and any potential contributing factors. This incident serves as a somber reminder for all road users to exercise caution and vigilance while driving to prevent such tragic accidents. Our thoughts are with the family and loved ones of the deceased driver during this difficult time.

The driver of a car died after his car collided head on with a sports utility vehicle (SUV) in Batac, Ilocos Norte.

item.title: Flash floods, landslide kill at least 45 in central Kenya
item.content:encoded: Flash floods and a landslide in central Kenya killed at least 45 people and injured over 110 others on Monday as floodwaters swept away houses and cars in the town of Mai Mahiu.

item.title: Braso na may kamay na tumubo sa likod ng isang babae, natanggal na
item.content:encoded: Matagumpay ang naging operasyon sa isang batang babae na may tumubong braso at kamay sa kaniyang likod. Naisagawa ito sa tulong ng GMA Kapuso Foundation at partner doctors nito.

item.title: Edgar Mortiz, binalikan ang 'love triangle' nila noon nina Nora Aunor at Tirso Cruz III
item.content:encoded:
Guy and Bot, Nora Aunor, Tirso Cruz III, Tambalang, Fans Summary: Before the iconic love team "Guy and Pip" of Nora Aunor and Tirso Cruz III gained fame, fans were already swooning over the tandem "Guy and Bot" of Nora and Edgar "Bobot" Mortiz. The duo, also known as the "Guy and Bot" love team, captured the hearts of many audiences with their onscreen chemistry and charming performances. While they may not have reached the same level of popularity as "Guy and Pip," Nora and Bobot's partnership was beloved by fans during their era. Their collaboration in various films and television shows cemented their status as one of the most memorable onscreen tandems in Philippine showbiz history. Overall, "Guy and Bot" may have paved the way for the success of "Guy and Pip," but their unique charm and camaraderie left a lasting impact on audiences during their time.

Bago pa man makilala noon ang iconic love team na "Guy and Pip" nina Nora Aunor at Tirso Cruz III, una munang isinigaw ng fans ang tambalang "Guy and Bot" nina Nora at Edgar "Bobot" Mortiz.

item.title: Speaker Romualdez, nagbabala laban sa mga mapagsamantalang negosyante: 'Moderate your greed'
item.content:encoded:
Speaker Martin Romualdez, warning, middleman, profiteering, skyrocketing prices

Speaker Martin Romualdez has issued a warning against unscrupulous traders and middlemen whom he referred to as "greedy for profit" regarding the rising prices of essential goods. He emphasized the need for fair market practices and urged authorities to crack down on those taking advantage of the situation by inflating prices. Romualdez expressed concern over the plight of ordinary Filipinos who are struggling to cope with the high cost of living, especially amidst the challenges brought about by the current pandemic. He called for stricter enforcement of laws to protect consumers and ensure that they are not exploited by opportunistic individuals seeking to maximize their profits. Romualdez's statement serves as a rallying cry for action to address the issue of price manipulation and exploitation in the market, with the aim of promoting a more equitable and just economic landscape for all.

Summary: Speaker Martin Romualdez warns against profiteering middlemen and calls for stricter enforcement of laws to protect consumers from skyrocketing prices of essential goods, emphasizing the need for fair market practices.

Nagbabala si Speaker Martin Romualdez laban sa mga mapagsamantalang nangangalakal at middleman na tinawag niyang "masyadong matakaw sa kita" kaugnay sa pagmahal ng ilang pangunahing bilihin.

item.title: Cha-cha reso not on Senate priority ahead of sine die break
item.content:encoded:
keywords: Resolution of Both Houses No. 6, Senate, priority, measures, sine die break Summary: The Resolution of Both Houses No. 6, which is not on the list of priority measures for the Senate before the sine die break, will not be among the laws expected to be passed during this period. The Senate is focusing on passing important legislation before the end of its session, and Resolution of Both Houses No. 6 does not seem to be a priority at this time. Despite the potential significance of the resolution, it appears that other bills and measures are taking precedence in the Senate's agenda. This decision suggests that Resolution of Both Houses No. 6 may not be addressed in the immediate future, as the Senate allocates its time and resources to more urgent matters. As the legislative calendar approaches its conclusion, it is likely that only the most crucial and time-sensitive issues will be considered for passage, leaving less pressing resolutions, such as No. 6, to be addressed at a later date or in the next legislative session.

Summary:

The Resolution of Both Houses No. 6 is not on the list of priority measures that the Senate is looking to pass before sine die break.

item.title: Environmental group calls for climate emergency amid extreme heat
item.content:encoded: An environmental group on Monday called for the declaration of a national climate emergency in the country due to the continuous temperature rise.

item.title: 2 pulis na nang-raid sa gumagawa ng pekeng titulo ng lupa sa Maynila, sinabuyan ng asido
item.content:encoded:
pulis, nalapnos, asido, ospital, pagawaan Summary: Two police officers were injured after being splashed with acid during a raid on a fake land title manufacturing facility in Santa Cruz, Manila. The officers were rushed to the hospital for treatment. The incident occurred while the authorities were investigating the illegal production of counterfeit land titles in the area. The attack with acid was a desperate attempt by the criminals to deter the police from uncovering their illegal activities. This incident highlights the dangers faced by law enforcement officers in carrying out their duties to uphold the law and protect the public. The police officers' swift response and bravery in the face of such danger are commendable and serve as a reminder of the risks they take every day to ensure the safety and security of the community.

Dalawang pulis ang nalapnos ang balat at kinailangang dalhin sa ospital matapos sabuyan ng asido sa sinalakay nilang pagawaan ng pekeng titulo ng lupa sa Santa Cruz, Maynila.

item.title: No winners of big lotto draws held on April 29
item.content:encoded:
Philippine Charity Sweepstakes Office, Grand Lotto 6/55, Mega Lotto 6/45, bettors, combination

Summary: The Philippine Charity Sweepstakes Office (PCSO) recently held draws for the Grand Lotto 6/55 and Mega Lotto 6/45 games without any bettors successfully guessing the winning combinations. The lack of winners means that the jackpot prizes for both games will continue to roll over to the next draws, potentially reaching even higher amounts. Despite the disappointing results for bettors, the anticipation and excitement for the next draws are expected to increase as more players try their luck in the hopes of winning the substantial prizes offered by the PCSO. The events underscore the challenging odds of winning in these popular lottery games, with players needing to rely on luck and chance to secure the elusive winning numbers. The PCSO will announce the new jackpot amounts for the upcoming draws, further fueling the enthusiasm and participation in the lottery games.


No bettor managed to correctly guess the right combinations for the Grand Lotto 6/55 and Mega Lotto 6/45, drawn by the Philippine Charity Sweepstakes Office (PCSO).

item.title: PISTON strike failed to paralyze public transport -- LTFRB
item.content:encoded:
nationwide, transport strike, LTFRB, public transportation system, failed Summary: The Land Transportation Franchising and Regulatory Board (LTFRB) reported that the nationwide transport strike did not succeed in paralyzing the public transportation system. The strike, which aimed to disrupt transportation services across the country, was unsuccessful in causing significant disruptions. Despite efforts to halt operations and garner support from transport groups, the strike fell short of its intended impact. The LTFRB affirmed that the public transportation system remained operational and continued to serve commuters throughout the strike. This outcome highlights the resilience of the transportation system and the ability of authorities to maintain order and facilitate travel for the public. Overall, the strike's failure to achieve its objectives underscores the importance of effective coordination and communication in ensuring the smooth operation of transportation services. The LTFRB's oversight and management played a crucial role in mitigating the potential disruptions that could have arisen from the strike.

Summary:

The nationwide transport strike failed to paralyze the public transportation system, the Land Transportation Franchising and Regulatory Board (LTFRB) said Monday.

item.title: New mobile radar can be deployed in the WPS -Air Force
item.content:encoded: The Philippine Air Force's (PAF's) newly acquired mobile surveillance radar system could be deployed in the West Philippine Sea, Jun Veneracion reported Monday on 24 Oras.

item.title: Alleged BIAF members caught selling high-powered weapons
item.content:encoded: An alleged member of the Bangsamoro Islamic Armed Forces Moro Islamic Liberation Front (BIAF-MILF) who was reportedly selling illegal firearms died in a shootout with the police in Maguindanao del Sur.

item.title: Estudyanteng binaril sa loob ng bahay habang sumasagot ng modules, kapatid umano ang suspek
item.content:encoded: Lumabas sa imbestigasyon ng pulisya na ang nakatatandang kapatid ang suspek sa pagkamatay ng 14-anyos na babaeng estudyante na tinamaan ng bala ng baril sa mukha habang sumasagot ng modules sa kanilang bahay sa Talisay City, Cebu.

item.title: US continues support for Philippines national coast watch
item.content:encoded: WASHINGTON, D.C. --The United States" Defense Threat Reduction Agency (DTRA) is committed to continuing its support to the Philippines" National Coast Watch System (NCWS).

item.title: Ukraine"s Zelenskiy urges US to speed up weapons deliveries
item.content:encoded: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said US weapons were arriving in small amounts and that the process needed to move faster as advancing Russian forces were trying to take advantage.

item.title: French actor Gerard Depardieu questioned over alleged sexual assaults
item.content:encoded: French screen legend Gerard Depardieu was detained for questioning on Monday in connection with alleged sexual assaults against two women on separate film sets, police sources said.

item.title: Estrada urges anti-kickback measure in pharma, medical professions
item.content:encoded: Senator Jinggoy Estrada on Monday called for the passage of an anti-kickback measure in the pharmaceutical industry and the practice of medicine.

item.title: China's new model claim 'nothing more than a new invention,' says Año
item.content:encoded: National Security Adviser Eduardo Año on Monday branded as ''nothing more than a new invention'' China"s so-called “new model” of conduct in the Ayungin Shoal.
