item.content:encoded: x

item.title: Balikatan Day 3: Chinese ships shadow PH, US and French flotilla in WPS
item.content:encoded:
Philippines, United States, France, Chinese warships, Balikatan Exercise Summary: Several Chinese warships continued to shadow the naval flotilla of the Philippines, United States, and France on the third day of the Balikatan Exercise in the West Philippine Sea. The presence of the Chinese warships raised tensions during the exercise. Despite the shadowing, the three participating countries remained focused on their joint maritime drills as part of the annual exercise aimed at enhancing interoperability and strengthening their defense capabilities. The Balikatan Exercise serves as a demonstration of the commitment of the Philippines, United States, and France to uphold freedom of navigation and promote regional security in the West Philippine Sea. The continuous surveillance by the Chinese warships highlighted the strategic importance of the region and the competing interests in the area. The participating countries reiterated their commitment to conducting the exercise in accordance with international laws and norms.

Several Chinese warships continued to shadow the naval flotilla of the Philippines, United States and France on the third day of the Balikatan Exercise in the West Philippine Sea.

item.title: Scotland"s Humza Yousaf resigns as country"s leader
item.content:encoded:
First Minister, Humza Yousaf, resigns, leader, Scottish National Party, contest held
Summary: Humza Yousaf, the First Minister of Scotland, has resigned from his position as leader of the Scottish National Party (SNP). He announced that a contest will be held to select his replacement. Yousaf's resignation marks a significant change in leadership for the SNP, which has been instrumental in advocating for Scottish independence. The decision to step down comes amidst growing tensions within the party and challenges faced by the Scottish government. Yousaf's successor will play a crucial role in shaping the future direction of the SNP and its ongoing political agenda. The upcoming leadership contest will be closely watched by supporters and critics alike as the SNP navigates through this period of transition.

Summary:

Scotland's First Minister Humza Yousaf resigned as leader of the Scottish National Party (SNP) on Monday and said he had ordered a contest be held to select a replacement.

item.title: Solons pay tribute to Barzaga for his 'integrity, dedication'
item.content:encoded:
Resolution, mourning, death, Dasmariñas City, lawmaker Summary: The House of Representatives adopted House Resolution 1691 on Monday to mourn the death of Elpidio Barzaga, Jr., a lawmaker from Dasmariñas City. The resolution was passed as a tribute to Barzaga, who served as a dedicated public servant and contributed significantly to the development of his constituency. Barzaga's passing was a great loss to the community and his colleagues in the House of Representatives. The resolution acknowledges his tireless work and dedication in serving the people of Dasmariñas City. The House Resolution 1691 is a fitting tribute to a respected lawmaker, highlighting his commitment to public service and his impact on the community he served.

Summary:

The House of Representatives on Monday adopted House Resolution 1691 mourning the death of Dasmariñas City lawmaker Elpidio Barzaga, Jr.

item.title: Marcos confident PH Army can secure Bangsamoro polls
item.content:encoded: President Ferdinand ''Bongbong'' Marcos Jr. on Monday called on the Philippine Army to help secure the Bangsamoro elections slated in 2025.

item.title: Speaker Romualdez warns vs agriculture, basic commodity profiteering
item.content:encoded: Speaker Martin Romualdez on Monday warned traders and middlemen against profiteering or jacking up prices of agricultural products and basic commodities.

item.title: Bumaril umano sa broadcaster na si Juan Jumalon, nasakote sa Dipolog
item.content:encoded: Naaresto na ng mga awtoridad sa Dipolog City, Zamboanga del Norte nitong Lunes ang taong bumaril umano sa broadcaster na si Juan "DJ Johnny Walker" Jumalon. Binaril at napatay habang naka-live broadcast noong Nobyembre 2023 sa Misamis Occidental ang biktima.

item.title: Between Bangkok"s mega highways, 'pocket parks" sprout
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: pocket parks, Bangkok, concrete blocks, tarmac highways, verdant Summary: In Bangkok, Thailand, amidst the urban landscape of crumbling concrete blocks and sweeping tarmac highways, pockets of green spaces known as "pocket parks" are emerging. These miniature oases provide a respite from the hustle and bustle of city life, offering a tranquil sanctuary for residents and visitors alike. These small patches of greenery are a stark contrast to the surrounding urban environment, serving as a reminder of the importance of nature in a bustling metropolis. The creation of pocket parks in Bangkok reflects a growing trend towards incorporating green spaces into urban planning, promoting sustainability and enhancing the quality of life for city dwellers. With their lush foliage and peaceful ambiance, these pocket parks serve as a vital link between the urban jungle and the natural world, offering a breath of fresh air in the midst of a bustling cityscape.

Between crumbling concrete blocks and sweeping tarmac highways, slivers of verdant "pocket parks" are sprouting in Thailand's capital Bangkok.

item.title: Ulo ng dalagita sa Cebu, pinamahayan ng sangkaterbang kuto
item.content:encoded:
kuto, suyod, 13-anyos, Argao, Cebu

Ang 13-anyos na babae sa Argao, Cebu, ay halos puno ng kuto sa kanyang ulo mula pa sa unang hagod ng suyod. Ang kanyang ulo ay puno ng sangkaterbang kuto, na nagdudulot ng malaking problema sa kanyang kalusugan at kagandahan. Ang pagkakaroon ng kuto ay maaring dulot ng hindi malinis na kapaligiran, pagkakalantad sa mga taong may kuto, o kawalan ng pagsasaalang-alang sa personal na kalinisan. Mahalaga na agarang tratuhin ang problema ng kuto upang maiwasan ang pagkalat nito sa iba at maiwasan ang pangmatagalang epekto nito sa kalusugan. Dapat bigyan ng atensyon at tamang lunas ang kondisyon ng kanyang ulo upang maging malinis at malayo sa sakit ang ulo ng babae.

Sa unang hagod pa lang ng suyod sa buhok ng isang 13-anyos na babae sa Argao, Cebu, halos napuno na ng kuto ang suyod. Bakit kaya pinamahayan ng sangkaterbang kuto ang kaniyang ulo? Alamin.

item.title: Speaker: House to probe 'gentleman's agreement' with China
item.content:encoded:
investigate, gentleman's agreement, former President, Rodrigo Duterte, China Summary: Speaker Martin Romualdez announced that the House of Representatives will investigate the alleged "gentleman's agreement" between former President Rodrigo Duterte and China. The investigation aims to shed light on the details of the agreement and its implications for the country's sovereignty and national security. Romualdez emphasized the importance of transparency and accountability in such matters that could impact the nation's interests. The alleged agreement has raised concerns among lawmakers and the public, prompting calls for a thorough examination of its terms and implications. The House's inquiry seeks to uncover any potential violations of the Constitution or laws that may have occurred as a result of the agreement. Romualdez affirmed the commitment of the House to uphold the country's sovereignty and protect its interests in dealing with foreign powers.

Speaker Martin Romualdez said the House of Representatives would investigate the alleged "gentleman's agreement" former President Rodrigo Duterte had with China.

item.title: Israel concerned over possible ICC arrest warrants related to Gaza
item.content:encoded: Israel is concerned that the International Criminal Court could be preparing to issue arrest warrants for officials on charges related to its devastating military assault on Gaza.

item.title: Pres. Marcos, may babala sa sino mang may masamang balak laban sa Bangsamoro polls sa 2025
item.content:encoded: Nanindigan si Pangulong Ferdinand ''Bongbong'' Marcos Jr. sa kaniyang hangarin na matuloy at magkaroon ng maayos na kauna-unahang Bangsamoro elections sa 2025. Ikinatuwa naman ng Mindanao solon ang matapang na pahayag ng pangulo laban sa sino mang nagpaplanong idiskaril ang halalan.

item.title: Pedro Sanchez says he will continue as Spain"s prime minister
item.content:encoded: Spain's Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez said on Monday that after a period of reflection about his future he had decided to continue as the country's leader.

item.title: DFA: Laws to celebrate friendship days with other countries not necessary
item.content:encoded: The Department of Foreign Affairs on Monday said that the celebration of "Friendship Days" with other countries does not necessitate legislation.

item.title: Myanmar records hottest ever April temperature of 48.2C
item.content:encoded: Myanmar recorded its hottest ever April temperature of 48.2 degrees Celsius (118.76 Fahrenheit), authorities said Monday, as the Southeast Asian nation bakes in a heatwave.

item.title: DENR to take water conservation steps amid 'alarming" Angat Dam water level
item.content:encoded: Water conservation measures will be implemented to ensure enough supply amid the "alarming" decline in Angat Dam's water level, the Department of Environment and Natural Resources (DENR) said Monday.

item.title: DOH shares alternative cooling techniques amid extreme hot weather
item.content:encoded: The Department of Health (DOH) on Monday advised the public to use alternative cooling techniques to fight the extreme heat without consuming too much water and power supply.

item.title: Robin Padilla files resolution seeking Cha-cha via con-con
item.content:encoded: Senator Robin Padilla on Monday filed a resolution that seeks to revise the 1987 Constitution through a constitutional convention.

item.title: Marcos awards troops hurt in BIFF encounter
item.content:encoded: President Ferdinand ''Bongbong'' Marcos Jr. conferred awards to seven soldiers who were wounded during an encounter with the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters (BIFF).

item.title: Senate urged to approve natural gas development bill
item.content:encoded:
House of Representatives, Senate, Philippine Downstream Natural Gas Industry Development Act, power supply, approval Summary: Two members of the House of Representatives are urging the Senate to approve the Philippine Downstream Natural Gas Industry Development Act. The lawmakers argue that the legislation is crucial in ensuring a sufficient power supply in the country. They believe that the development of the downstream natural gas industry will lead to increased energy security and stability. The Act aims to promote the use of natural gas as a cleaner alternative to other fossil fuels, ultimately reducing greenhouse gas emissions. By encouraging the growth of the natural gas sector, the lawmakers hope to diversify the country's energy sources and reduce its dependence on imported fuels. They emphasize the importance of passing the Act to meet the growing energy demands of the nation and to achieve a more sustainable and resilient energy future.

Summary:

Two members of the House of Representatives urge the Senate to approve the proposed Philippine Downstream Natural Gas Industry Development Act to ensure sufficient power supply in the country.

item.title: Brownouts possible due to power demand, plant outages -- DOE
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: Department of Energy, brownouts, power demand, outages, El Niño phenomenon Summary: The Department of Energy has issued a warning about the possibility of brownouts occurring due to the rising power demand and the outages of power plants, exacerbated by the El Niño phenomenon. The increasing demand for power coupled with the disruptions in power plant operations have raised concerns about potential electricity shortages. The DOE urged the public to practice energy conservation measures to help mitigate the risk of brownouts. The agency emphasized the importance of maintaining a stable power supply during the El Niño season to prevent disruptions in daily activities. It is crucial for both individuals and businesses to be mindful of their energy consumption to ensure the reliable delivery of electricity. The DOE's advisory serves as a reminder for everyone to be proactive in managing their power usage to prevent potential brownouts during this period of increased power demand.

Summary:

The Department of Energy (DOE) on Monday said there is a possibility of brownouts due to the increasing power demand and the outages of power plants amid the El Niño phenomenon.

item.title: Marcos: No artificial power crisis in PH
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: President Marcos, artificial power crisis, red alerts, yellow alerts, Luzon and Visayas grids Summary: President Marcos denies the existence of an artificial power crisis in the country, despite frequent red and yellow alerts being issued for the Luzon and Visayas grids. These alerts indicate a shortage in power supply reserves, leading to potential power outages or disruptions. Despite this, President Marcos insists that there is no crisis looming, contrary to the alerts being issued regularly. The situation raises concerns about the country's energy stability and the potential impact on businesses and households. The discrepancies between the official stance and the operational alerts suggest a disconnect in the communication and management of the power supply situation. Addressing these issues is crucial to ensuring a reliable and sustainable power supply for the country's needs.

President Marcos says there is no artificial power crisis hounding the country despite the almost daily red and yellow alerts being declared on Luzon and Visayas grids.

item.title: CICC: Individual not country behind Marcos deepfake video
item.content:encoded: An official from the Cybercrime Investigation and Coordinating Center on Monday said an individual and not a country was behind the ''deepfake'' video of President Ferdinand Marcos Jr.

item.title: PISTON, others file amended petition for TRO vs. PUVMP
item.content:encoded: A day before the deadline for unconsolidated public utility vehicles (PUV), transport groups filed a supplemental petition and again asked the Supreme Court (SC) to issue a temporary restraining order against the PUV Modernization Program.

item.title: Illegally dismissed probationary employees entitled to backwages -SC
item.content:encoded: The backwages of illegally dismissed probationary employees include wages when compensation was withheld up to reinstatement, the Supreme Court (SC) ruled.

item.title: Workers' group seeks measures to protect employees amid severe heat
item.content:encoded: A workers" rights group on Monday called on employers to implement measures to aid workers amid the scorching heat affecting most of the country.

item.title: Police deployed along Welcome Rotonda for transport strike
item.content:encoded: Philippine National Police (PNP) personnel were deployed along Welcome Rotonda in Quezon City (QC) on Monday for the ongoing three-day transportation strike against the government's Public Utility Vehicle Modernization Program (PUVMP).

item.title: Blinken arrives in Saudi Arabia to discuss Israel normalization, post-war Gaza
item.content:encoded: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken arrived in Saudi Arabia on Monday, the first stop in a broader trip to the Middle East to discuss issues including the governance of Gaza once the war with Israel ends.

item.title: House minority reps seek probe on red, yellow power alerts
item.content:encoded: Minority congressmen called for a House of Representatives inquiry into the red and yellow power alerts in Luzon and Visayas grids amid the unplanned outages of over 32 power plants.

item.title: Senate reso honoring 'staunch human rights defender' Saguisag filed
item.content:encoded: A resolution honoring the life and contributions of former Rene Saguisag to the nation has been filed in the Senate.

item.title: Employers, workers urge review of PUV Modernization Program
item.content:encoded:
review, jeepney modernization program, impact, livelihood, operators
Summary:
Employers and workers groups are urging for an immediate review of the jeepney modernization program due to its detrimental effects on the livelihoods of operators and drivers. The program has caused adverse impacts on the sources of income for operators and drivers, creating significant challenges for their ability to make a living. Employers and workers groups are concerned about the negative consequences of the program and are calling for a closer examination of its effects on the livelihoods of those in the transportation industry. The current situation has raised alarm bells for the need to reassess the modernization program and consider alternative solutions that will not harm the livelihoods of operators and drivers. The call for a review underscores the urgency of addressing the challenges faced by this sector and finding a more sustainable path forward.

Summary:

Employers, workers groups called for an immediate review the jeepney modernization program due to its adverse impact on the livelihood of operators and drivers.

item.title: Agencies sign IRR on gov"t workers" right to self-organize
item.content:encoded:

Summary: The Department of Justice took the lead in signing the implementing rules and regulations regarding the right of government employees to self-organize. The event aimed to ensure that government employees have the freedom to form associations and collectively bargain for their working conditions. The DOJ played a crucial role in facilitating this process and promoting the rights of government workers. The signing of the regulations marked a significant step towards empowering government employees and protecting their rights within the workplace. This initiative emphasizes the importance of self-organization in enabling employees to voice their concerns and participate in decision-making processes that affect their work environment. By establishing clear guidelines and procedures for self-organization, the government aims to create a more inclusive and transparent working environment for its employees. The DOJ's efforts in enacting these regulations reflect a commitment to upholding the rights and welfare of government workers.

Summary:

The Department of Justice (DOJ) on Monday spearheaded the signing of the implementing rules and regulations on the right of government employees to self-organize.

item.content:encoded:
reaffirmed commitment, normalize communities, Bangsamoro, amnesty application, former rebels Summary: President Ferdinand ''Bongbong'' Marcos Jr. reaffirmed his commitment to normalize communities in Bangsamoro through the amnesty application of former rebels. He emphasized the importance of this process in bringing peace and stability to the region. By granting amnesty to former rebels, the government aims to reintegrate them into society and provide them with opportunities for a fresh start. This initiative is part of a larger effort to address the root causes of conflict in Bangsamoro and promote reconciliation among all stakeholders. President Marcos Jr. expressed his determination to work towards lasting peace and development in the region through inclusive and sustainable approaches.

President Ferdinand ''Bongbong'' Marcos Jr. on Monday reaffirmed his commitment to normalize communities in Bangsamoro through the amnesty application of former rebels.

item.title: Gunman in killing of broadcaster Juan Jumalon nabbed in Dipolog --task force
item.content:encoded:
Broadcaster, Juan "DJ Johnny Walker," arrest, gunman, killing Summary: Law enforcement authorities arrested the suspected gunman responsible for the killing of broadcaster Juan "DJ Johnny Walker" Jumalon in Dipolog City, Zamboanga del Norte. The arrest took place on Monday morning in relation to the murder case. Juan "DJ Johnny Walker" was shot and killed, sparking an investigation that led to the apprehension of the suspect. The arrest is a significant development in the case that rocked the local community and left many shocked by the violent incident. The authorities worked diligently to track down and capture the individual believed to be responsible for the tragic crime. This arrest provides a sense of closure and justice for the family and friends of the victim, as they seek accountability for the senseless act of violence.

Law enforcement authorities on Monday morning arrested the suspected gunman in the killing of broadcaster Juan "DJ Johnny Walker" Jumalon in Dipolog City, Zamboanga del Norte.

item.title: Heat breaks, other safety protocols should be mandatory, group says
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: workplace safety, Department of Labor and Employment, heat breaks, protocol, mandatory Summary: A workplace safety group has emphasized the importance of implementing mandatory protocols for heat breaks as the temperature rises. They have directed their urging towards the Department of Labor and Employment to ensure the safety and well-being of workers in intense heat conditions. The group's recommendation includes the establishment of specific guidelines to address the risks associated with high temperatures in the workplace. By making heat breaks and other safety measures mandatory, they aim to protect employees from heat-related illnesses and accidents. It is crucial for organizations to prioritize the health and safety of their workforce by adhering to these recommended protocols.< >Summary:

A workplace safety group urged the Department of Labor and Employment to make heat breaks and other protocol mandatory amid the intense heat.

item.content:encoded:
Keywords: President Ferdinand Marcos Jr., Moro combatants, peace, security, Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao (BARMM) Summary: President Ferdinand "Bongbong" Marcos Jr. emphasized the significant role played by the first group of Moro combatants in upholding peace and security in the Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao (BARMM). Their involvement in ensuring the safety and well-being of the community has been instrumental in fostering trust and cooperation among different groups within the region. President Marcos Jr. acknowledged the sacrifices and hard work of the Moro combatants in safeguarding the peace process and promoting a peaceful coexistence among all residents of the BARMM. The President's recognition of their contributions reflects the government's commitment to supporting and empowering the Moro combatants in their efforts towards lasting peace and security in the region.

President Marcos Jr. recognized their sacrifices and commitment to the peace process, affirming the government's support for their peace-building initiatives.

President Ferdinand ''Bongbong'' Marcos Jr. on Monday highlighted the role of the first batch of Moro combatants in maintaining peace and security in the Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao (BARMM).

item.title: PCG: 'Loitering' Chinese-flagged research vessel in Catanduanes back to Northern Samar
item.content:encoded:
research vessel, Chinese-flagged, Catanduanes, Viga, Mapanas
Summary: The Chinese-flagged research vessel initially spotted northeast of Viga, Catanduanes has since moved back near Mapanas, Northern Samar as of Sunday evening, according to the PCG. The vessel's change in location was confirmed on Sunday, providing a shift in its proximity from Catanduanes to Northern Samar. This development indicates the movement and activity of the research vessel within Philippine waters, prompting the PCG to monitor its movements closely. The vessel's presence near Mapanas, Northern Samar raises questions and concerns about its activities and intentions in the region. The PCG's continued surveillance and monitoring of the vessel's movements are essential for ensuring maritime security and upholding territorial sovereignty. The shifting location of the Chinese research vessel highlights the ongoing maritime challenges and potential threats faced in Philippine waters, emphasizing the need for vigilance and proactive measures to safeguard national interests and maritime boundaries.

The Chinese-flagged research vessel seen northeast of Viga, Catanduanes already moved back near Mapanas, Northern Samar as of Sunday evening, the PCG said Monday.

item.title: At least 13 Palestinians killed in Israeli strikes on Rafah, medical officials say
item.content:encoded:
Israeli, air strikes, Gaza, Rafah, medics Summary: Israeli air strikes targeted three houses in Rafah, a city in southern Gaza, resulting in the deaths of 13 individuals and numerous injuries. The attack caused widespread devastation and loss of life, with medics on the scene providing assistance to the wounded. The strikes were part of ongoing conflict and tensions in the region, leading to heightened concern for civilian casualties and humanitarian crisis. The targeted houses in Rafah bore the brunt of the air strikes, with many families affected by the sudden and deadly assault. The incident underscores the volatile and dangerous situation in Gaza, as violence continues to escalate with devastating consequences for the local population.

Summary:

Israeli air strikes on three houses in the southern Gaza city of Rafah killed 13 people and wounded many others, medics said on Monday.

item.title: Pinoy students suffer in wilting heat, thwarting education efforts
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: Sweltering heat, Philippines, students, education, impact Summary: The sweltering heat in the Philippines is having a detrimental effect on students and hindering the country's progress in education. The extreme weather conditions make it challenging for students to focus and learn effectively, ultimately impacting their academic performance. This issue is particularly concerning as the Philippines is striving to catch up to its neighboring countries in terms of education standards. The heat not only poses physical discomfort but also affects the overall learning environment, leading to decreased productivity and motivation among students. As a result, the educational system in the country is facing significant challenges in providing quality education to its students. It is essential for the government and educational institutions to address this issue and implement measures to mitigate the impact of the sweltering heat on students' learning experience.

Sweltering heat in the Philippines takes a toll on students, hampering the country's efforts to catch up to its neighbors in education.

item.title: Luzon grid on yellow alert on April 29, 2024
item.content:encoded: The Luzon grid will be placed on yellow alert on Monday, according to the National Grid Corporation of the Philippines (NGCP).

item.title: LTO: Collected fines in NCR up by nearly 205% in Q1 2024
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: fines, motorists, Metro Manila, increase, LTO-NCR
Summary:
The Land Transportation Office - National Capital Region (LTO-NCR) reported a significant surge in fines collected from motorists in Metro Manila during the first quarter of 2024, showing a remarkable increase of almost 205% compared to the same period in 2023. This substantial rise indicates a stricter enforcement of traffic regulations and a crackdown on erring drivers in the region. The LTO-NCR's efforts have resulted in a substantial boost in revenue generated from fines, highlighting the importance of traffic discipline and adherence to road rules. With the increase in fines collected, it is clear that authorities are taking a more proactive approach towards ensuring road safety and improving traffic flow in Metro Manila. The surge in fines serves as a deterrent for motorists who violate traffic laws, emphasizing the need for compliance and responsible driving behavior on the roads of the Philippine capital.

The fines collected from erring motorists in Metro Manila increased by almost 205% in the first quarter of 2024 compared to the same period in 2023, LTO-NCR said on Monday.

item.title: Jeepney drivers, operators start 3-day transport strike
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: jeepney drivers, operators, government, strike, Modernization Program Summary: Jeepney drivers and operators started a three-day transport strike to protest the government's Public Utility Vehicle Modernization Program. The program aims to replace old jeepneys with modern, environment-friendly vehicles. However, many drivers and operators are opposed to the program, citing concerns over the cost of new vehicles and potential job losses. The strike has caused disruptions in public transportation, affecting commuters who rely on jeepneys for their daily commute. The government is urging drivers and operators to cooperate with the modernization program to improve the quality and safety of public transportation. As the strike enters its second day, tensions between the government and the drivers/operators continue to escalate.

Some jeepney drivers and operators opposing the government's Public Utility Vehicle Modernization Program began their three-day transport strike on Monday.

item.title: Pro-Palestinian campus protests spread across US despite police crackdowns
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: Pro-Palestinian protests, US universities, coast-to-coast, police crackdowns, arrests Summary:

Pro-Palestinian protests at US universities continued to spread across the country over the weekend, with police crackdowns and arrests persisting into the following week. The demonstrations showed no signs of slowing down as activists voiced their support for the Palestinian cause. Coast-to-coast protests highlighted the widespread outrage over the ongoing violence in Gaza and the West Bank, drawing attention to the plight of the Palestinian people. Despite facing police intervention, protesters remained steadfast in their demands for justice and an end to the Israeli occupation. The escalating tensions at universities underscored the growing support for Palestinian rights on campuses nationwide, signaling a shift in public opinion regarding the Israeli-Palestinian conflict. The confrontations between demonstrators and law enforcement reflected the deep-seated emotions surrounding the issue and the determination of activists to bring about change through their protest actions.

Summary:

Pro-Palestinian protests at US universities showed no sign of slowing as they spread coast-to-coast over the weekend and police crackdowns and arrests continued into another week.

item.title: World Central Kitchen to resume Gaza aid after staff killed by Israeli strike
item.content:encoded:
charity, World Central Kitchen, Gaza Strip, Israeli air strike, aid workers
World Central Kitchen charity will resume operations in the Gaza Strip a month after an Israeli air strike killed seven of its aid workers. The charity announced its return on Monday, stating its commitment to continue providing aid and support to the people of Gaza. The resumption of operations comes after a period of mourning and reflection following the tragic loss of its team members. Despite the risks and challenges, World Central Kitchen remains dedicated to its mission of feeding those in need and working towards a world where no one goes hungry. The organization's decision to return demonstrates its resilience and unwavering commitment to serving communities affected by conflict and disaster.

Summary:

The World Central Kitchen (WCK) charity said it would resume operations in the Gaza Strip on Monday, a month after an Israeli air strike killed seven of its aid workers.

item.title: Prince Harry due in London, then Nigeria with Meghan
item.content:encoded:
Invictus Games, Prince Harry, return, 10th anniversary, Nigeria
Prince Harry will be returning to Britain in May to celebrate the 10th anniversary of his Invictus Games. Following the celebration, he will join his wife Meghan on a visit to Nigeria. This announcement was made by his spokesperson on Sunday. The Invictus Games is an international adaptive multi-sport competition for wounded, injured, and sick military personnel and veterans. The event holds special significance for Prince Harry, as it was created by him in 2014. The upcoming visit to Nigeria will mark another engagement for the royal couple as they continue their work in supporting various charitable causes and organizations. Prince Harry's return to Britain and subsequent trip to Nigeria demonstrates his ongoing commitment to the Invictus Games and his dedication to using his platform for positive impact.

Summary: Prince Harry will be returning to Britain to celebrate the 10th anniversary of the Invictus Games before embarking on a visit to Nigeria with his wife Meghan. These engagements reflect his continued support for the event and his dedication to philanthropic work.

Prince Harry will return to Britain to celebrate the 10th anniversary of his Invictus Games in May, before joining his wife Meghan on a visit to Nigeria, his spokesperson said on Sunday.

item.title: No winners of Ultra Lotto 6/58, Superlotto 6/49 on Sunday, April 28, 2024
item.content:encoded:
lotto, draws, Sunday, April 28, winners
No winners were announced for both of the major lotto draws held on Sunday, April 28. The draws did not yield any jackpot prize winners, leaving the prize pools untouched. Despite the absence of winners in the recent draws, excitement remains high as hopeful players continue to dream of hitting the jackpot in future lottery games.

Summary:

There were no winners of either of the big lotto draws held on Sunday, April 28.

item.title: China confronts Japanese politicians visiting East China Sea islands
item.content:encoded:
coast guard, confront, Japanese lawmakers, East China Sea, embassy Summary: The Chinese coast guard confronted Japanese lawmakers in the East China Sea, a disputed territory claimed by both countries. The incident occurred in waters where tensions have been high, leading to confrontations and disputes over territorial claims. The Chinese embassy in Tokyo confirmed the incident, which heightened tensions between the two countries. The presence of the coast guard in the area further escalated the situation, as both parties assert their sovereignty over the region. The confrontation underscores the ongoing territorial disputes between China and Japan, adding to existing tensions in the East China Sea. Overall, the incident serves as a reminder of the complex geopolitical dynamics in the region and the challenges of managing competing territorial claims.

Summary:

China's coast guard confronted Japanese lawmakers in waters claimed by both countries in the East China Sea, China's embassy in Tokyo and Japanese media said on Sunday.

item.title: Ukraine pulls back from three villages as eastern front worsens, top commander says
item.content:encoded:
Commander, Ukraine, troops, Russia, front
Ukraine's top commander reported that the outnumbered troops in Kyiv had retreated to new positions west of three villages on the eastern front due to the significant concentration of Russian forces in the area. As a result, the troops are now stationed at new positions to reassess the situation and strategize their next move. The development highlights the intense fighting and military buildup in the region as the conflict between Ukraine and Russia escalates. The move signifies a defensive retreat to regroup and reinforce their positions against the advancing Russian forces in the area. The commander's statement indicates the challenging situation faced by Ukrainian troops as they strive to defend their territory against the well-equipped and numerous Russian troops. Forces are likely preparing for continued clashes and possible further incursions by Russian forces in the region.

Summary:

Ukraine's top commander said Kyiv's outnumbered troops had fallen back to new positions west of three villages on the eastern front where Russia has concentrated significant forces.

item.title: Israel agrees to listen to US concerns before Rafah move, says White House
item.content:encoded:
Israel, US concerns, invasion, Rafah, Gaza Israel has agreed to consult with the US before launching an invasion of Rafah in Gaza. White House national security spokesperson John Kirby confirmed that Israel will listen to US thoughts and concerns regarding the planned invasion. This decision indicates a level of cooperation between the two allies, allowing the US to potentially influence Israel's actions in the region. The move also suggests a strategic coordination between the US and Israel in addressing the situation in Gaza and ensuring that any military actions are properly considered and discussed. The agreement to engage in dialogue before military action demonstrates a commitment to diplomatic communication and potentially avoiding escalation of conflict in the region.

Summary: Israel has agreed to consult with the US before launching an invasion of Rafah in Gaza, indicating cooperation and strategic coordination between the two allies. This decision allows the US to influence Israel's actions and emphasizes the importance of diplomatic communication in addressing the situation in Gaza.

Israel has agreed to listen to US concerns and thoughts before it launches an invasion of the border city of Rafah in Gaza, White House national security spokesperson John Kirby said on Sunday.

item.title: Chinese-flagged research vessel detected near Catanduanes --AFP
item.content:encoded:
AFP, Chinese-flagged, research vessel, Catanduanes, unauthorized

The Armed Forces of the Philippines (AFP) recently discovered a Chinese-flagged research vessel operating without authorization near Viga in Catanduanes. The presence of the vessel was detected northeast of the area within the past week, raising concerns about potential incursions into Philippine territory. The AFP emphasized that the unauthorized presence of foreign vessels in Philippine waters is a violation of sovereignty and is closely monitored to ensure the country's maritime security. The incident highlights the ongoing maritime tensions in the region, particularly concerning China's assertive behavior in the South China Sea. The AFP's detection of the Chinese research vessel serves as a reminder of the need for vigilance and proactive measures to protect Philippine territorial integrity.

Summary:
The AFP detected a Chinese-flagged research vessel operating without authorization near Viga in Catanduanes, highlighting concerns about sovereignty and maritime security. The incident underscores ongoing tensions in the region and the need for vigilance to protect Philippine territory.

The Armed Forces of the Philippines (AFP) over the weekend said it detected the unauthorized presence of a Chinese-flagged research vessel northeast of Viga in Catanduanes in the past week.

item.title: Carmen, Cotabato, inulan ng yelo
item.content:encoded:
hailstorm, yelo, Carmen, Cotabato, tag-init Summary:
A hailstorm, characterized by the falling of yelo, occurred in the town of Carmen, Cotabato amid the hot tag-init season. This unusual weather phenomenon brought unexpected rains of ice pellets to the area. Residents were surprised and taken aback by the sudden hailstorm as it is a rare occurrence for the region. The hailstorm caused some concerns among the locals due to its potential impact on crops and infrastructure. This event serves as a reminder of the unpredictable nature of weather patterns and the importance of being prepared for such unexpected occurrences.

Sa gitna ng tag-init, nag-hailstorm o umulan ng yelo sa Carmen, Cotabato!

item.title: Pulis, patay nang mabaril ng 8-anyos na anak
item.content:encoded:
Sagay, Negros Occidental, pulis, barilin, anak walong-taong-gulang
Summary: In Sagay, Negros Occidental, a police officer was shot by his eight-year-old son. The tragic incident resulted in the death of the officer. The circumstances surrounding the shooting are still under investigation, but initial reports suggest that the child gained access to a firearm and accidentally fired it, hitting his father. The community is in shock, and authorities are working to understand how such a young child was able to access a loaded weapon. The loss of the officer has left his family and colleagues devastated, highlighting the importance of gun safety and responsible firearm ownership. The incident serves as a tragic reminder of the potential dangers posed by firearms in homes, especially when not stored properly and securely. It also raises concerns about the impact of such a traumatic event on the young child who unintentionally caused the death of his own father.

Patay ang isang pulis sa Sagay, Negros Occidental, matapos barilin ng anak na walong taong gulang.

item.title: Motorcycle taxi rider nabbed for allegedly selling shabu to passengers
item.content:encoded: A motorcycle taxi rider was arrested for allegedly selling illegal drugs in Batasan, Quezon City.

item.title: China Navy, patuloy ang presensya sa nagaganap na Balikatan Exercise sa WPS
item.content:encoded:
Warship, China, multilateral, maritime exercise, Balikatan Summary: China's warship continues to persist in the multilateral maritime exercise of Balikatan in the northern west of Palawan in the West Philippine Sea. The presence of the Chinese warship raises concerns as it shows their assertiveness in the disputed waters. The ongoing Balikatan exercise aims to enhance interoperability and strengthen the defense capabilities of the participating countries. However, the intrusion of China's warship disrupts the peaceful conduct of the exercise, further escalating tensions in the region. The repeated incursions by Chinese vessels highlight the ongoing maritime disputes and sovereignty issues in the West Philippine Sea, which require diplomatic resolutions and adherence to international laws and agreements.

Hindi pa rin tinatantanan ng warship ng China ang nagaganap na multilateral maritime exercise ng Balikatan sa hilagang kanluran ng Palawan dito sa West Philipine Sea.

item.title: 'Global Boiling': Metro Manila hits all-time high record of 45°C heat index
item.content:encoded:
Metro Manila, record high, heat index, 45°C, Saturday
Summary: Metro Manila experienced a new all-time high record of 45°C heat index on Saturday, as reported by Katrina Son on 24 Oras Weekend. This extreme heat is concerning as it poses health risks to residents and may lead to heat-related illnesses. The scorching temperatures can also have negative effects on the environment, agriculture, and infrastructure. It is crucial for individuals to take necessary precautions, such as staying hydrated, avoiding prolonged exposure to the sun, and seeking shelter in cool areas. Authorities should also implement measures to help mitigate the impact of the heatwave and ensure the well-being of the community.

Metro Manila reached a new all-time high record of 45°C heat index on Saturday, according to Katrina Son"s report on 24 Oras Weekend.

item.title: More Chinese ships shadowing PH, US navies during Balikatan
item.content:encoded:
vessels, Chinese, shadowing, Philippines, Balikatan
Summary:
During the Balikatan joint military exercise in the West Philippine Sea, Chinese vessels were spotted shadowing naval vessels from the Philippines, the United States, and France. This occurrence raises concerns about China's increasingly assertive behavior in the region. The presence of Chinese vessels near the military exercises involving multiple countries highlights the complex dynamics at play in the contested waters of the West Philippine Sea. The actions of the Chinese vessels continue to provoke tensions and challenge the sovereignty of the Philippines in the region. The incident underscores the ongoing maritime disputes and power struggles in the South China Sea, where China's growing presence has been met with criticism and opposition from neighboring countries and international allies.

More Chinese vessels were seen shadowing naval vessels of the Philippines, the United States and France during the Balikatan joint military exercise in the West Philippine Sea on Sunday.

item.title: Some US officials say in internal memo Israel may be violating international law in Gaza
item.content:encoded: The report cited examples of Israeli military actions such as striking protected sites and civilian infrastructure and causing "unconscionably high levels of civilian harm".

item.title: DOTr to proceed with PUV modernization pending SC decision
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: DOTr, Public Utility Vehicle Modernization Program, implementation, SC, petition
Summary: The Department of Transportation (DOTr) is determined to proceed with the Public Utility Vehicle Modernization Program despite the pending decision of the Supreme Court (SC) on a petition seeking to stop the program. The DOTr is standing firm in its commitment to modernize public transportation in the Philippines, emphasizing the importance of upgrading and improving the fleet of public utility vehicles. While the SC deliberates on the petition, the DOTr is moving forward with its plans for the modernization program, which aims to enhance the safety, efficiency, and convenience of public transportation for commuters. The program seeks to replace old and dilapidated vehicles with newer, more environmentally-friendly models equipped with modern amenities and safety features. Despite the legal challenge, the DOTr remains steadfast in its efforts to push through with the modernization program for the benefit of the commuting public.

Summary:

The DOTr stood firm that they would implement the Public Utility Vehicle Modernization Program while awaiting the decision of the SC on the petition to halt the program.

item.title: House to focus oversight on rice prices, cybersecurity and WPS
item.content:encoded:
strengthen, oversight, House of Representatives, legislative priorities, session Summary: The House of Representatives plans to enhance its oversight functions following the completion of its legislative priorities once it reconvenes on Monday. This latest move is part of the House's efforts to ensure accountability and transparency in governance. By strengthening oversight mechanisms, the House aims to promote good governance and prevent any potential abuse of power. This decision reflects the House's commitment to upholding its responsibilities and serving the interests of the public. Additionally, the focus on oversight aligns with the House's mandate to provide checks and balances on the executive branch. Overall, the House's upcoming session is expected to prioritize oversight activities to hold government officials accountable and safeguard the integrity of the legislative process. As lawmakers reconvene, they are preparing to tackle a range of issues and prioritize measures that will enhance their oversight role to fulfill their duties effectively.

Summary:

The House of Representatives will seek to strengthen its oversight functions after completing its legislative priorities when it resumes session on Monday.

item.title: Israeli foreign minister says hostage deal would defer Rafah operation
item.content:encoded:
foreign minister, planned incursion, southern Gaza city, Rafah, Israeli hostages
Summary: Israel's foreign minister announced on Saturday the possibility of halting a planned incursion into the southern Gaza city of Rafah in exchange for a potential deal to secure the release of Israeli hostages held by Hamas. The foreign minister's statement indicated a willingness to negotiate and potentially prevent further escalation in the region. Talks seem to be ongoing, with the outcome potentially influencing the military decision to enter Rafah. This development highlights the complex dynamics at play in the Israeli-Palestinian conflict and the importance of diplomatic efforts in finding peaceful solutions. The scenario underscores the significance of hostage situations in influencing political decisions and military actions, showcasing how hostage crises can impact larger geopolitical strategies and decision-making processes. Overall, the situation reflects the delicate balance between security concerns and the pursuit of peaceful resolutions in the volatile region.

Israel's foreign minister said on Saturday that a planned incursion into the southern Gaza city of Rafah could be suspended should a deal emerge to secure the release of Israeli hostages held by Hamas.

item.title: Two Israeli hostages seen in latest video issued by Hamas
item.content:encoded:
Hamas, new video, Israeli hostages, Gaza Strip, assault
Summary:
Hamas released a new video on Saturday showing two Israeli hostages who have been held in the Gaza Strip since the Oct. 7 assault on southern Israel. The video is believed to be a tactic by Hamas to gain leverage in negotiations with Israel. The hostages appeared to be in good health in the video, but their exact condition and treatment remain unclear. The Israeli government has been working to secure the release of the hostages, but details of any negotiations have not been made public. The video raises concerns about the well-being of the hostages and the ongoing tensions between Hamas and Israel.

Hamas released a new video on Saturday that appeared to show two Israeli hostages who have been held in the Gaza Strip since the Oct. 7 assault on southern Israel.

item.title: PAGCOR reports double-digit growth in 1st quarter earnings
item.content:encoded:
Philippine Amusement and Gaming Corp., total income, increase, first quarter, 2024 Summary: The Philippine Amusement and Gaming Corp. reported a significant 42.57% increase in its total income in the first three months of 2024. This rise reflects a strong performance in the gaming sector despite challenges faced during this period. The increase in income indicates a positive trend for the company's financials and may suggest success in its operational strategies. The growth in total income reinforces the corporation's position in the industry and showcases its ability to adapt and thrive in dynamic market conditions. Overall, the reported surge in earnings signifies a promising start to the year for the Philippine Amusement and Gaming Corp.


The Philippine Amusement and Gaming Corp. over the weekend reported a 42.57% increase in its total income in the first three months of 2024.

item.title: DepEd: F2F classes in public schools on April 29-30 suspended
item.content:encoded:
Department of Education, suspension, face-to-face classes, public schools, distance learning Summary: The Department of Education announced the suspension of face-to-face classes in all public schools nationwide on April 29 to 30. This decision comes as a response to the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic. The shift to distance learning will ensure the safety of students and teachers and prevent the spread of the virus. This move follows the government's efforts to prioritize the health and well-being of the education sector. The Department of Education aims to continue providing quality education through alternative modes of learning during this challenging time. Students and parents are advised to stay updated with further announcements and guidelines regarding the shift to distance learning.

The Department of Education on Sunday announced the suspension of face-to-face classes in all public schools nationwide and a shift to distance learning on April 29 to 30.

item.title: Senate seeks passage of 20 priority bills before session adjourns

Senate, deliberations, Marcos Jr., administration, priority

item.title: 4 of 6 cooling towers at NAIA Terminal 3 back in operation
item.content:encoded:
cooling towers, Ninoy Aquino International Airport Terminal 3, Manila International Airport Authority, operation, bogged down
Summary:
Four out of the six cooling towers at Ninoy Aquino International Airport Terminal 3, which were previously not functioning properly, are now operational again. The Manila International Airport Authority has confirmed that the cooling towers have been repaired and are back in service. This development is crucial for maintaining the airport's operations and ensuring the comfort of passengers and staff. The repair work was likely carried out efficiently to minimize any disruptions to the airport's functioning. This news provides assurance that efforts are being made to address maintenance issues promptly and effectively at the airport.

Four out of the six cooling towers which bogged down at the Ninoy Aquino International Airport Terminal 3 are now back in operation, according to the Manila International Airport Authority.

item.title: PH forces ready vs WPS threats by end of Marcos term -- Amb. Romualdez
item.content:encoded:
Ambassador, Jose Manuel Romualdez, Armed Forces of the Philippines, US assistance, external threats

Summary: Ambassador Jose Manuel Romualdez anticipates that by the end of the Marcos administration, the Armed Forces of the Philippines will be adequately equipped to handle external threats with the assistance of the United States. This collaboration aims to strengthen the military capabilities of the Philippines and enhance their defense readiness. The Ambassador's statement highlights the importance of partnership and cooperation between the two nations in ensuring regional security and stability. The expected support from the US signifies a commitment to bolstering the Philippines' defense capabilities and safeguarding against potential threats. Overall, this initiative reflects a proactive approach towards addressing security challenges and reinforcing the defense infrastructure of the Philippines.

Ambassador Jose Manuel Romualdez said he is expecting the Armed Forces of the Philippines, with US assistance, will be equipped against external threats by the end of the Marcos administration.

item.title: P2-M worth of kush, cannabis oil found inside vape pens at NAIA
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: P2 million, kush, cannabis oil, vape pens, Ninoy Aquino International Airport Summary: Authorities at the Ninoy Aquino International Airport uncovered a stash of illegal substances worth an estimated P2 million. Hidden inside 70 vape pens were kush and cannabis oil, which were being smuggled through the airport. The discovery highlights the ongoing issue of drug trafficking and the use of innovative methods to transport illegal substances. It also underscores the importance of vigilance and thorough inspections by airport authorities to prevent the entry of contraband into the country. The operation was a success in thwarting the attempted smuggling of these substances, likely destined for distribution in the Philippines. Such incidents serve as a reminder of the need for increased security measures and strict enforcement of laws to combat drug-related activities and protect the public from the dangers associated with illegal drugs. The case is under investigation to identify the individuals behind the attempted smuggling and to prevent future similar incidents from occurring.

Summary:

Authorities discovered an estimated P2 million worth of kush and cannabis oil hidden inside 70 vape pens at the Ninoy Aquino International Airport.

item.title: MWSS: Water supply still sufficient despite El Niño affecting Angat Dam
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: Metropolitan Waterworks and Sewerage System, water supply, sufficient, decreasing water level, Angat Dam Summary: The Metropolitan Waterworks and Sewerage System reassured the public that despite the decreasing water level at Angat Dam caused by El Niño, the water supply remains sufficient to meet the needs of consumers. The agency stated that they are closely monitoring the situation and implementing measures to ensure continuous water availability. While the decreasing water level is a concern, there is no immediate threat to the water supply. Consumers are advised to continue practicing water conservation to help mitigate the effects of the El Niño phenomenon on water resources. The Metropolitan Waterworks and Sewerage System's proactive approach to managing the water supply demonstrates their commitment to ensuring the sustainability of water resources in the face of challenges such as El Niño.

The Metropolitan Waterworks and Sewerage System said Sunday the water supply is still sufficient for the needs of consumers despite the decreasing water level at Angat Dam due to El Niño.

item.title: 8-year-old dubbed 'Youngest Weaver" in Ilocos Norte
item.content:encoded: An eight-year-old girl showcased her talent in weaving at the Gumaba Cultural Center in Pinili, Ilocos Norte.

item.title: Bicolano engineer develops thermal insulating powder
item.content:encoded:
Engineer, Bicolano, thermal insulating powder, coating, paint Summary: A Bicolano engineer has developed a revolutionary thermal insulating powder that can be used as a coating or paint, successfully reducing indoor temperatures by 30 to 60 percent. This innovative product provides an effective solution for combating high indoor temperatures, offering a significant improvement in comfort and energy efficiency. The engineer's creation has the potential to make a substantial impact in various settings, including residential, commercial, and industrial buildings. The versatile nature of this powder allows it to be easily applied, making it a practical and efficient solution for a wide range of applications. With its remarkable ability to reduce temperatures effectively, this thermal insulating powder has the potential to revolutionize the way buildings are cooled, providing a sustainable and cost-effective alternative to traditional cooling methods.

Summary:

A Bicolano engineer made a thermal insulating powder that can be applied as coating or paint, which can reduce indoor temperatures by 30 percent to 60 percent.

item.title: Fragile Pope Francis back on the road with day trip to Venice
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: Pope Francis, Venice, trip, health scares, resilience

Pope Francis is set to visit Venice for his first trip of the year, which will test his mobility and resilience following recent health scares. The Pope has faced several health issues in the past, including a colon surgery and a bout of sciatica. This trip will demonstrate his ability to continue carrying out his duties and travels despite his health challenges. The visit to Venice is an important occasion for Pope Francis as he engages with the local community and addresses issues relevant to the region. It will also allow him to connect with the people of Venice and offer his support and guidance during this time. The Pope's visit serves as a reminder of his commitment to serving others and spreading messages of peace and unity. It is a significant moment for both the Catholic Church and the people of Venice, who will welcome Pope Francis with open arms. Overall, this trip reflects the Pope's determination and dedication to his role as the leader of the Catholic Church.

Summary: Pope Francis is traveling to Venice for his first trip of the year, highlighting his mobility and resilience following recent health scares. This visit allows him to engage with the local community, offer support, and spread messages of peace and unity.

Pope Francis travels to Venice on Sunday for his first trip of the year, testing his mobility and resilience after a number of health scares in recent months.

item.title: Comelec eyes arrival of first 20K counting machines for 2025 polls in August
item.content:encoded:
Commission on Elections, automated counting machines, 2025 elections, Philippines, arrival
Summary:
The Commission on Elections announced that around 20,000 units of automated counting machines for the 2025 national and local elections are expected to arrive in the Philippines by August. This technology will greatly aid in the electoral process by ensuring accurate and efficient counting of votes. The automated machines are a crucial component in modernizing and streamlining the election process. The timely arrival of these machines signifies a proactive approach by the Commission on Elections in preparing for the upcoming elections. With the use of automated counting machines, the voting process is expected to be more transparent and secure, enhancing overall trust in the electoral system. The introduction of this technology marks a significant step towards a more advanced and reliable electoral system in the Philippines.
Summary:

The Commission on Elections said Sunday it is expecting the initial batch of around 20,000 units of automated counting machines that will be used in the 2025 national and local elections to arrive in the Philippines by August.
