item.title: Man in Abra dies after getting punched
item.content:encoded:
Barangay Patiao, Peñarrubia, Abra; man; died; punched; barangay tanod
Summary: A 36-year-old man from Barangay Patiao, Peñarrubia, Abra died after allegedly being punched three times by a barangay tanod. The incident resulted in the man's death, raising concerns about the use of force by barangay officials. The exact circumstances leading to the altercation remain unclear, prompting calls for a thorough investigation into the matter. The victim's family and the community are demanding justice and accountability for the tragic loss. The incident highlights the importance of proper training and oversight for barangay tanods to prevent similar incidents in the future.

A 36-year-old man in Barangay Patiao, Peñarrubia, Abra died reportedly after he was punched three times by a barangay tanod.

item.title: 12 quakes, 8 tremors logged at Taal Volcano in 24 hours
item.content:encoded:
PHIVOLCS, Taal Volcano, 12 volcanic earthquakes, eight volcanic tremors, report

Summary: PHIVOLCS reported 12 volcanic earthquakes at Taal Volcano, including eight volcanic tremors. This elevated seismic activity suggests increased volcanic unrest at Taal. The volcano has been under constant monitoring, and authorities are closely monitoring the situation for any potential volcanic activity. Residents in nearby areas should be prepared for possible evacuation if the situation escalates. The continuous seismic activity indicates a high level of magma movement beneath the volcano, which could lead to a volcanic eruption. Scientists are monitoring the volcano closely and providing updates to ensure the safety of the surrounding communities.

PHIVOLCS reported 12 volcanic earthquakes, including eight volcanic tremors, at the Taal Volcano.

item.title: Russian missiles attack residential area in Ukraine's Kharkiv, says mayor
item.content:encoded: Russian missiles attacked a residential district of Ukraine's second largest city, Kharkiv, early on Wednesday, Mayor Ihor Terekhov said on Telegram.

item.title: US, Russia set for a showdown at UN over nuclear weapons in space
item.content:encoded: The United States and Russia are set to face off over nuclear weapons in space on Wednesday at the United Nations Security Council, which is due to vote on a U.S.-drafted resolution calling on countries to prevent an arms race in outer space.

item.title: North Korea leader Kim's sister: We will build overwhelming military power
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: Kim Yo Jong, North Korea, military power, sovereignty, regional peace Summary: Kim Yo Jong, the influential sister of North Korean leader Kim Jong Un, conveyed a message through KCNA news agency that North Korea is determined to bolster its military strength to safeguard its sovereignty and ensure regional peace. She emphasized the country's commitment to building an overwhelmingly strong military force. Kim Yo Jong's statement underscores North Korea's ongoing efforts to secure its autonomy and promote stability in the region. The declaration highlights the regime's focus on maintaining a robust defense capability as a strategic priority. Pyongyang's dedication to reinforcing its military power reflects a broader strategy to enhance its national security posture and protect its interests in the face of external threats.

Kim Yo Jong, the powerful sister of North Korean leader Kim Jong Un, said the country will continue to build overwhelming and the strongest military power to protect its sovereignty and regional peace, the North's KCNA news agency reported on Wednesday.

item.title: Colombian court recognizes environmental refugees
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: Colombian court, environmental calamities, forced displacement, state obligations, affected citizens Summary: The Colombian court has made a landmark ruling declaring that environmental calamities, whether sudden or gradual, can be considered a cause of forced displacement. This decision places legal obligations on the state to provide protection and assistance to citizens affected by such disasters. The ruling underscores the recognition of the link between environmental degradation and human displacement, highlighting the need for proactive measures to mitigate these impacts. By holding the state accountable for ensuring the well-being of affected individuals, the court sets a precedent for upholding environmental rights and promoting environmental justice in Colombia. This decision represents a significant shift towards recognizing the interconnectedness between environmental issues and human rights, signaling a step towards greater accountability and protection for those impacted by environmental disasters.

Summary: The Colombian court has ruled that environmental calamities can lead to forced displacement, imposing obligations on the state to protect and aid affected citizens. This decision signifies the acknowledgment of the relationship between environmental degradation and human displacement, emphasizing the importance of proactive measures to address these issues. By holding the state accountable, the ruling sets a precedent for promoting environmental rights and justice in Colombia, advocating for the well-being of those impacted by environmental disasters.

A Colombian court has ruled that environmental calamities, sudden or gradual, can legally be considered a cause of forced displacement, placing obligations on the state to shield and aid affected citizens.

item.title: MIAA, BFP, DOTR continue probe into NAIA parking lot fire
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: investigation, cause, fire, NAIA parking lot, vehicles

Authorities are currently investigating the cause of a fire at the NAIA parking lot that resulted in the destruction of multiple parked vehicles. The incident occurred on Monday and has left investigators searching for clues as to how the fire started. The fire caused significant damage to the vehicles present in the parking lot, raising concerns about the safety and security of the area. The authorities have not yet determined whether the fire was accidental or intentionally set, but they are working diligently to uncover the truth. The investigation is ongoing, and authorities are urging anyone with information about the incident to come forward. The aftermath of the fire has left many affected individuals without transportation and facing potential financial losses. It is crucial for authorities to determine the cause of the fire to prevent future incidents and ensure the safety of those utilizing the parking lot.

Summary:

Authorities are continuing their investigation into the possible cause of the fire at the NAIA parking lot that destroyed several parked vehicles on Monday.

item.title: Major arrests at NYU as Gaza protests spread in US campuses
item.content:encoded:
arrested, pro-Palestinian protests, New York University, student demonstrations, Israel Summary:

Over 130 people were arrested during pro-Palestinian protests at New York University as student demonstrations in the US escalate over Israel's actions in Gaza. The protests were in response to Israel's bombing and blockade of Gaza, which has garnered widespread criticism internationally. The demonstrations at NYU reflect a growing sentiment of solidarity with the Palestinian people against Israeli aggression. The arrests indicate a strong response by law enforcement to the protests, highlighting the tensions and heated emotions surrounding the issue. As the conflict continues to escalate, more protests and demonstrations are likely to take place across the US, with students playing a significant role in advocating for justice and peace in the region.

Over 130 people were arrested during pro-Palestinian protests at New York University, as student demonstrations gather pace in the US over Israel's bombardment and blockade of Gaza.

item.title: Spain pushes Catholic Church to compensate abuse victims
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: Spain, left-wing government, Catholic Church, sexual abuse, compensation Summary: The left-wing government of Spain is increasing pressure on the Catholic Church to compensate victims of sexual abuse. They are demanding that the Church take responsibility for the abuse that occurred under its watch. This move is part of a larger push for accountability and justice for survivors of abuse. The government's actions highlight the need for institutions to address and rectify systemic issues of abuse and cover-up. By holding the Church accountable, the government is sending a strong message that no institution is above the law when it comes to protecting victims and ensuring justice. This move also underscores the government's commitment to addressing the harm caused by sexual abuse and working towards healing and restitution for survivors. Ultimately, the government's actions aim to bring justice and closure to those who have suffered at the hands of the Church.

Summary: Spain's left-wing government is increasing pressure on the Catholic Church to compensate victims of sexual abuse. They are demanding that the Church take responsibility for the abuse that occurred under its watch. This move is part of a larger push for accountability and justice for survivors of abuse. The government's actions highlight the need for institutions to address and rectify systemic issues of abuse and cover-up. By holding the Church accountable, the government is sending a strong message that no institution is above the law when it comes to protecting victims and ensuring justice. This move also underscores the government's commitment to addressing the harm caused by sexual abuse and working towards healing and restitution for survivors. Ultimately, the government's actions aim to bring justice and closure to those who have suffered at the hands of the Church.

Spain's left-wing government on Tuesday upped the pressure on the Catholic Church to compensate victims of sexual abuse committed on its watch.

item.title: Long-awaited aid to Ukraine poised to pass US Congress, weapons coming soon
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: US officials, administration, $1-billion military aid package, Ukraine, shipments Summary: The administration, according to two US officials, is in the process of preparing a $1-billion military aid package for Ukraine. This aid package would enable the shipments of military assistance to Ukraine to occur within days. The aid package demonstrates the United States' support for Ukraine in the face of ongoing geopolitical tensions. This move is likely to be viewed as a response to the increased military presence and actions of Russia in the region. The aid package could provide Ukraine with much-needed resources to bolster its defense capabilities and deter further aggression. The swift delivery of this military aid underscores the US commitment to supporting Ukraine's sovereignty and security.

Summary: The US government is preparing a $1-billion military aid package for Ukraine, signaling strong support for the country amid escalating tensions with Russia. This aid package will enable swift shipments of military assistance to Ukraine and demonstrate the US commitment to bolstering Ukraine's defense capabilities.

Two US officials said the administration was already preparing a $1-billion military aid package for Ukraine. That would clear the way for shipments of military assistance within days.

item.title: PCO slams Marcos 'deepfake' audio
item.content:encoded:
PCO, manipulated video, President Ferdinand “Bongbong” Marcos Jr., military, disowned Summary:

The Presidential Communications Office (PCO) disowned a manipulated video circulating online. The video featured an audio of President Ferdinand “Bongbong” Marcos Jr. supposedly instructing the military to act against a foreign country.

The Presidential Communications Office (PCO) disowned a manipulated video circulating online featuring an audio of President Ferdinand “Bongbong” Marcos Jr. supposedly instructing the military to act against a foreign country.

item.title: Atletang sira-sira ang sapatos, namayagpag pa rin sa karera at nanalo ng gintong medalya
item.content:encoded:
track and field, athlete, broken shoes, gold medal, perseverance Summary: A 17-year-old school athlete in track and field overcame the obstacle of having broken shoes to pursue his dreams, including winning a gold medal. Despite the challenges he faced, he persisted and gradually started achieving his goals. His determination and hard work paid off as he started to see success in his sport. The broken shoes did not hinder his progress but rather fueled his drive to succeed. Through perseverance and dedication, he was able to overcome the odds and make progress towards his goals. This story serves as a reminder of the importance of resilience and tenacity in the face of obstacles.

Hindi naging sagabal ang sira-sirang sapatos ng isang 17-anyos na lalaking school athlete sa larangan ng track and field para habulin ang kaniyang mga pangarap, kabilang na ang makapag-uwi ng gintong medalya. Ang bunga ng kaniyang pagtitiis, unti-unti na niyang nakakamit.

item.title: FEO-PNP recommends revoking Quiboloy's firearms license
item.content:encoded: The Firearms and Explosives Office of the Philippine National Police (FEO-PNP) has recommended the revocation of Pastor Apollo Quiboloy's license to own and possess firearms (LTOPF).

item.title: 17-year-old dies after being stabbed with barbeque stick, bread knife in QC
item.content:encoded: A 17-year old boy died after getting stabbed with a barbecue stick and a bread knife amid a brawl in Quezon City.

item.title: Caloocan, Quezon City suspend face-to-face classes in public schools on April 24, 2024
item.content:encoded: The local governments of Caloocan City and Quezon City announced a suspension of face-to-face classes for public schools on Wednesday, April 24, 2024 due to the hot weather.

item.title: Banggaan sa loob ng banyo sa isang bar, nauwi sa pamamaril sa Las Piñas
item.content:encoded: Nauwi sa pamamaril ang sigalot ng ilang customer na nagsimula sa banggaan sa loob ng banyo ng ilang isang bar sa Las Piñas City. Ang isa sa apat na biktima, kritikal ang lagay.

item.title: No winners of major lotto draws on Tuesday, April 23, 2024
item.content:encoded:
lotto, draws, winners, Tuesday, April 23, 2024
No winners were announced for any of the major lotto draws that took place on Tuesday, April 23, 2024. This means that nobody was able to match all the numbers drawn in the respective lotteries, resulting in no jackpot winners. The lack of winners indicates that the prize pools for these lotto games will roll over to the next draw, potentially leading to even larger jackpots in the future. The unsuccessful draws add to the anticipation for the next round of lotto games, as players will have another chance to try their luck and win the coveted prizes. The absence of winners in the lotto draws signifies a missed opportunity for participants to claim the significant cash rewards that were up for grabs. Overall, the results of these draws highlight the unpredictable nature of lotteries and the excitement that comes with the prospect of winning big.

Summary:

There were no winners of any of the big lotto draws held on Tuesday, April 23, 2024.

item.title: Four injured in Las Piñas bar shooting
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: shooting, bar, Las Piñas City, injured, critical
Summary: Four individuals, including one critically, were injured during a shooting incident at a bar in Las Piñas City. The incident, reported by Marisol Abduraman on "24 Oras," left the victims with varying degrees of injuries. The shooting took place at an undisclosed location in the city, causing panic and chaos among patrons and staff present at the bar. Authorities are currently investigating the incident to determine the motive behind the shooting and identify the perpetrators responsible for the violence. The injured individuals were immediately taken to the hospital for medical treatment, with one of them reported to be in critical condition. The community is in shock and on edge following the shooting, as residents hope for swift action from law enforcement to ensure the safety and security of the public.

Summary:

Four individuals were injured, one of them critically, during a shooting incident at a bar in Las Piñas City, Marisol Abduraman reported on “24 Oras.”

item.title: Estrada to push for adoption of wage hike bill if House version increases amount
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: Senator Jinggoy Estrada, colleagues, House of Representatives, minimum wage hike, proposal Summary: Senator Jinggoy Estrada is open to persuading his fellow senators to adopt the House of Representatives' proposal for increasing the minimum wage if it surpasses the Senate's suggested amount. He is willing to work towards implementing a higher wage hike if proposed by the congressmen. This move signifies his willingness to bridge the gap between the two chambers and prioritize the welfare of workers.estrada's flexibility in pushing for a higher minimum wage shows his commitment to addressing the needs of the labor force. By advocating for a potentially higher amount, he demonstrates a proactive approach to improving the economic conditions of Filipino workers. The collaboration between the Senate and the House of Representatives in determining the minimum wage hike reflects a collective effort to ensure fair compensation for employees. Estrada's advocacy for a robust wage increase underscores the importance of legislative cooperation in addressing socio-economic issues. Overall, his willingness to negotiate and support a higher minimum wage signifies a step towards providing better economic opportunities for the Filipino workforce.

Summary: Senator Jinggoy Estrada is willing to convince his colleagues to adopt the House of Representatives' version of the bill seeking to increase the minimum wage hike if congressmen propose a higher amount than the Senate's version. This demonstrates his commitment to addressing the needs of workers and bridging the gap between the two chambers. Estrada's flexibility in advocating for a potentially higher minimum wage signals a proactive approach to improving economic conditions and prioritizing fair compensation for employees. The collaboration between the Senate and the House of Representatives underlines a collective effort to ensure better economic opportunities for the Filipino workforce. His support for a robust wage increase illustrates the importance of legislative cooperation in addressing socio-economic issues, contributing to a better future for workers.

Senator Jinggoy Estrada is willing to convince his colleagues to adopt the House of Representatives' version of the bill seeking to increase the minimum wage hike if congressmen propose a higher amount than the Senate's version.

item.title: UN rights chief 'horrified" by mass graves found at Gaza hospitals
item.content:encoded: Scores of bodies in mass graves were found at Nasser Hospital after it was abandoned by Israeli troops. Bodies were also found at Al Shifa Hospital after an Israeli special forces operation.

item.title: Babae, mamaga ang mukha at nasunog ang balat dahil sa tina na pangkulay ng buhok?
item.content:encoded: Dahil umano sa tina na pangkulay ng buhok, isang ginang ang namaga ang mukha, tila nasunog at nagkasugat-sugat pa sa Surigao del Sur. Bakit kaya ito nangyari? Alamin.

item.title: 1 dead, 1 injured after siblings pinned by boulder in Davao del Sur
item.content:encoded: An 18-month-old girl died while her four-year-old brother was injured after they were pinned by a large boulder while bathing in a river in Sta. Cruz, Davao del Sur.

item.title: BFP urged to acquire firefighting helicopters
item.content:encoded: The Bureau of Fire Protection should include funding for the acquisition of firefighting helicopters in its proposed budget for 2025 amid the increasing number of fire incidents in the country, a lawmaker said Tuesday.

item.title: Lalaking 3 araw na gising dahil sa epekto umano ng 'bato,' hinostage ang sarili niyang pamilya sa Cebu
item.content:encoded: Hinostage ng isang padre de pamilya ang kaniyang asawa at mga anak para gawing panangga laban sa mga taong nais umano siyang saktan sa Cebu City. Ang lalaki, sinasabing tatlong araw nang gising matapos gumamit ng ilegal na droga na tinawag niyang "bato," o shabu.

item.title: Pets may suffer from paw blisters, heat stroke -PAWS
item.content:encoded:
pets, suffer, heat, animal welfare rights group, country Summary: pets - animal welfare rights group - suffer - heat - across the country. The animal welfare rights group emphasized that pets are also at risk of suffering from the severe heat experienced nationwide. They highlighted the importance of providing proper care and protection for pets during extreme weather conditions to ensure their well-being. With temperatures soaring, pet owners are urged to take precautions such as providing access to shade, plenty of water, and avoiding leaving them in hot vehicles. It is crucial for pet owners to be aware of the signs of heat stress in animals and take immediate action if their pets show any symptoms. By being proactive and mindful of the effects of heat on pets, we can help prevent unnecessary suffering and keep our furry companions safe and healthy.

An animal welfare rights group on Tuesday said pets may also suffer from the severe heat experienced across the country.

item.title: Jeepney driver loses P300K cash in Taguig fire that left 15 families homeless
item.content:encoded:
jeepney driver, lost, P300,000, cash, fire

Summary: A jeepney driver in Taguig City lost a significant amount of money, P300,000 in cash, after a fire broke out in his house. The fire also left 15 families homeless in the area. The driver had borrowed the money and had kept it in his house, which unfortunately burned down in the fire. The driver not only lost his home but also the borrowed money, adding to his woes. The incident highlights the devastating impact of fires on communities, leaving multiple families without shelter and belongings. It serves as a reminder of the importance of fire safety measures and preparedness to prevent such tragedies from reoccurring.

A jeepney driver lost P300,000 in cash after the money he borrowed burned inside his house in a fire that left 15 families homeless in Taguig City on Tuesday.

item.title: Canada-bound OFWs must undergo verification process --DMW
item.content:encoded:
advisory, Department of Migrant Workers, overseas Filipino workers, Canada, verification process Summary: The Department of Migrant Workers (DMW) has issued an advisory requiring overseas Filipino workers (OFWs) bound for Canada to undergo the agency's verification process. This process is crucial in ensuring the welfare and protection of OFWs while working abroad, specifically in Canada. By going through this verification process, OFWs can provide necessary information and documentation to the DMW, enabling them to assist in case of emergencies or issues that may arise during their employment in Canada. This initiative aims to streamline the coordination between the DMW and OFWs, enhancing the support and services available to Filipino migrant workers in Canada. This advisory emphasizes the importance of proper channels and procedures in ensuring the safety and well-being of OFWs, reinforcing the government's commitment to safeguarding the rights and interests of Filipino migrant workers overseas.


The Department of Migrant Workers (DMW) has issued an advisory, which requires overseas Filipino workers (OFWs) bound for Canada to go through the agency"s verification process.

item.title: Labis na pag-iisip sa pera, maaaring maging sanhi ng mga sakit, base sa pag-aaral
item.content:encoded: Lumabas sa isang pag-aaral na nagdudulot ng matinding stress na maaaring mauwi sa iba't ibang sakit ang labis na pag-iisip o problema sa pera.

item.title: CA halts release of modified rice, eggplant
item.content:encoded: The Court of Appeals (CA) has issued a cease and desist order against the University of the Philippines-Los Baños (UPLB) and the Philippine Rice Research Institute (PRRI) to stop the release of genetically modified rice and eggplant products.

item.title: Marcos: PH eyes mid-year rollout of swine flu vaccines from Vietnam
item.content:encoded: President Ferdinand "Bongbong" Marcos Jr. said Tuesday that vaccines for African swine flu would be rolled out in the Philippines in June or July this year.

item.title: DOH: 1 million children in BARMM now vaccinated vs measles
item.content:encoded: At least one million children in the Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao (BARMM) have received the vaccine against measles, weeks after the Department of Health (DOH) launched an immunization drive to curb the measles outbreak in the region.

item.title: Luzon grid on red, yellow alert on April 23--NGCP
item.content:encoded: The Luzon grid was placed under red and yellow alert status on Tuesday, according to the National Grid Corporation of the Philippines (NGCP).

item.title: Go presses DSWD's Gatchalian on 'selective' aid distribution
item.content:encoded:
Questioned, DSWD Secretary, selective distribution, government aid, public office
Senator Bong Go questioned DSWD Secretary Rex Gatchalian over the supposed "selective" distribution of government aid and if this was in preparation for a run for public office. Go raised concerns about the fairness of the aid distribution process and whether it was being used for political gain. Gatchalian defended the department's actions, stating that the aid was being distributed based on need and that there was no political agenda involved. Go continued to press Gatchalian on the issue, demanding transparency and accountability in the aid distribution process. The exchange between the two officials highlighted the ongoing tensions surrounding government aid distribution and raised questions about the motivations behind the distribution process. Despite Gatchalian's assurances, concerns about the fairness and transparency of the aid distribution process remain unresolved.

Summary: Senator Bong Go questioned DSWD Secretary Rex Gatchalian about the alleged selective distribution of government aid and its potential impact on public office aspirations. Gatchalian defended the department's actions, emphasizing the need-based criteria for aid distribution and denying any political motives. Go, however, continued to push for transparency and accountability in the aid distribution process, raising doubts about the fairness and motivations behind the government's actions. The exchange underscored ongoing concerns about the distribution of government aid and highlighted potential political implications for those involved.

Senator Bong Go questioned DSWD Secretary Rex Gatchalian over the supposed "selective" distribution of government aid and if this was in preparation for a run for public office.

item.title: CA affirms dismissal of 3 BI officers involved in 'pastillas' scam
item.content:encoded:
Dismissal, Bureau of Immigration officers, pastillas scam, illegal entry, Chinese nationals Summary:
The Court of Appeals upheld the termination of 3 Bureau of Immigration officers involved in the "pastillas" scam that facilitated the illicit entry of Chinese nationals into the Philippines. The officers were found guilty of corruption and abuse of authority in exchange for allowing the illegal entry of Chinese nationals seeking to work in online gaming operations. The scam, named after the Filipino sweet treat "pastillas," involved officers receiving bribes to facilitate the seamless entry and exit of Chinese nationals without proper documentation. The dismissal of the officers signifies a crackdown on corrupt practices within the Bureau of Immigration and reinforces the importance of upholding integrity and professionalism in immigration enforcement. The Court's decision serves as a warning to officials involved in similar unlawful activities, emphasizing the consequences of engaging in bribery, facilitating illegal entry, and abusing their positions for personal gain.

Summary:

The Court of Appeals affirmed the dismissal of 3 Bureau of Immigration officers who were part of the 'pastillas" scam that allowed the illegal entry of Chinese nationals into the country.

item.title: Philippine Air Force to send aircraft to international exercise for first time
item.content:encoded:
Philippine Air Force, aircraft, international exercise, first time, Tuesday
Summary: The Philippine Air Force announced on Tuesday that it will participate in an international exercise for the first time, sending its aircraft to join the event. This marks a significant milestone for the PAF as it showcases its capabilities on the global stage. The decision to take part in the exercise reflects the PAF's commitment to enhancing its readiness and fostering international cooperation in the field of defense. This opportunity will allow the PAF to train alongside foreign air forces and gain valuable experience in conducting joint operations. It also signifies a step towards strengthening partnerships with other countries and building a stronger presence in the international defense community. Overall, this participation demonstrates the PAF's dedication to improving its capabilities and keeping pace with global advancements in airpower.

The Philippine Air Force (PAF) on Tuesday said that it will be sending aircraft to an international exercise for the first time.

item.title: Pres. Marcos, sinabing masuwerte siya na 'very protective' ang kaniyang misis na si Liza
item.content:encoded: Sinabi ni Pangulong Ferdinand "Bongbong" Marcos Jr. nitong Martes, na mapalad siya sa pagkakaroon ng isang "very protective" na kabiyak na si First Lady Liza Araneta-Marcos.

item.title: DOH: Doctors found accepting gifts from drug firms may lose license
item.content:encoded: Following the revelation of an alleged marketing scheme of certain pharmaceutical companies, the Department of Health (DOH) on Tuesday warned that doctors who accept gifts in exchange of their preference to the firms" manufactured medicines might cost them their medical licenses.

item.title: China slams US claims it is fueling Ukraine war by supplying Russia
item.content:encoded: China condemned on Tuesday as "groundless accusations" US claims that Beijing was fueling the Ukraine war by supplying components to Russia which it uses for its military expansion.

item.title: Marcos: PH rice supply enough despite El Niño
item.content:encoded: President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. on assured the public that there is enough supply of rice in the country despite the El Niño phenomenon.

item.title: Chinese vessels surge in WPS amid Balikatan --PH Navy
item.content:encoded: The number of Chinese vessels has increased in the West Philippines Sea amid Balikatan, the joint military exercise of the Philippines and United States, the Philippine Navy said on Tuesday.

item.title: Manila suspends face-to-face classes on Wednesday due to 'dangerous' heat
item.content:encoded: Manila Mayor Honey Lacuna-Pangan suspended the face-to-face classes for public and private schools on Wednesday due to the dangerous heat level.

item.title: EJKs remain a serious problem in PH -- US gov't report
item.content:encoded: A United States government report said that extra-judicial killings (EJKs) remained a serious problem in the Philippines in 2023 and that there were no significant changes in the country"s human rights situation.

item.title: Zamboanga grad tops over 1,100 Pharmacist Licensure Exam passers
item.content:encoded:
Universidad de Zamboanga, Pharmacists Licensure Examination, PRC, top, graduate Summary: A graduate from the Universidad de Zamboanga emerged as the topnotcher in the 2024 Pharmacists Licensure Examination organized by the Professional Regulation Commission (PRC). The successful candidate achieved the highest score among all examinees during the recent examination. The PRC officially announced this accomplishment on Tuesday, confirming the exceptional performance of the graduate. This achievement highlights the academic excellence and competency of graduates from the Universidad de Zamboanga's pharmacy program. The top result in the licensure exam reflects positively on the university's quality education and commitment to producing highly skilled professionals in the field of pharmacy.


A graduate from the Universidad de Zamboanga topped the 2024 Pharmacists Licensure Examination conducted earlier this month, the PRC announced on Tuesday.

item.title: Pres. Marcos, 'di aalisin si VP Sara sa DepEd
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: Ferdinand Marcos Jr., Sara Duterte, Department of Education, Cabinet, reason Summary:
President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. sees no reason to remove Vice President Sara Duterte as the Secretary of the Department of Education and member of his Cabinet. Despite criticisms and speculations from various sectors, Marcos Jr. believes Duterte is suited for the role and continues to trust her capabilities. Duterte has been handling her responsibilities effectively and efficiently, earning the president's confidence in her leadership. The president values continuity and stability within his administration, and therefore, does not see a need to make any changes in the Education sector. Duterte's performance in her position has been commendable, aligning with the president's vision and goals for the department. Overall, Marcos Jr. stands by his decision to retain Duterte in her current role, citing her qualifications and contributions to the administration's efforts in improving the education system.

Walang nakikitang dahilan si Pangulong Ferdinand Marcos Jr. para alisin niya si Vice President Sara Duterte bilang kalihim ng Department of Education, at miyembro ng kaniyang Gabinete.

item.title: MIAA orders removal of dry grass at NAIA parking lot after fire incident
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: MIAA, removal, dry grass, NAIA parking lot, fire incident Summary: The Manila International Airport Authority (MIAA) has instructed the removal of dry grass at the Ninoy Aquino International Airport (NAIA) parking lot following a recent fire incident. The order comes after a fire broke out in the grassy area of the parking lot, prompting concerns about safety and fire hazards. The MIAA is taking proactive measures to ensure the safety of passengers and airport personnel by addressing the issue of dry grass that could potentially fuel another fire. The decision to remove the dry grass is a response to the fire incident and aims to prevent future accidents and ensure the security of the airport premises. This directive highlights the importance of maintaining a safe and secure environment at the airport to prevent any untoward incidents. The MIAA's swift action demonstrates their commitment to prioritizing safety and security measures at NAIA.

Summary:

MIAA orders removal of dry grass at NAIA parking lot after fire incident.

item.title: Owners of cars burned in NAIA parking fire have reached out - MIAA
item.content:encoded: The owners of six of the 19 cars that were damaged in a parking lot fire at Ninoy Aquino International Airport (NAIA) have reached out to the Manila International Airport Authority (MIAA).

item.title: Luzon, Visayas grids on yellow alert
item.content:encoded: The National Grid Corporation of the Philippines on Tuesday placed the Luzon and Visayas grids on yellow alert.

item.title: Marcos orders NIA to put irrigation systems in El Niño-hit Occidental Mindoro
item.content:encoded: President Ferdinand "Bongbong" Marcos Jr. on Tuesday directed the National Irrigation Administration (NIA) to set up irrigation systems in Occidental Mindoro to augment agricultural production in several municipalities amid the El Niño phenomenon.

item.title: Pertussis infection still on 'upward trend' as cases hit 1,566
item.content:encoded: More than 1,500 Filipinos, mostly young children, have now been infected by the “whooping cough” or pertussis this year, as the Department of Health (DOH) continuously awaits the arrival of more vaccines to combat the highly contagious disease.

item.title: Speaker Romualdez: Defense, education, healthcare to be prioritized when session resumes
item.content:encoded:
Congress, Speaker Romualdez, prioritize, national defense, education, healthcare Summary: Speaker Romualdez announced that Congress will focus on passing legislation to strengthen national defense and improve access to education and healthcare during the upcoming session. The priorities include laws that will enhance the country's security and defense capabilities, as well as measures to expand opportunities for education and promote better healthcare services for all citizens. Romualdez emphasized the importance of these issues in ensuring the well-being and progress of the nation, highlighting the need for continuous improvement in these key areas. The government's commitment to addressing these priorities reflects its dedication to promoting a stronger and more resilient society, where citizens have access to quality education, healthcare, and security. Through these legislative efforts, Congress aims to make significant strides in enhancing the overall well-being and prosperity of the country.

Speaker Romualdez said Congress would prioritize laws for stronger national defense and expanded access to education and healthcare when the second regular session of the 19th Congress resumes.

item.title: Marcos says he's lucky to have a 'very protective' wife
item.content:encoded:
lucky, wife, protective, President, Ferdinand "Bongbong" Marcos Jr. Summary: President Ferdinand "Bongbong" Marcos Jr. expressed his gratitude for his wife, First Lady Liza Araneta-Marcos, stating that he feels fortunate to have her by his side. He admires her protective nature towards him and values her support as his partner. President Marcos Jr. emphasized the importance of having a strong and caring spouse in his life, especially in his position as a public figure. He credited his wife for being a source of strength and comfort to him, acknowledging her role in his personal and professional life. The couple's strong bond and mutual respect for each other have been a pillar of support for President Marcos Jr. throughout his career in politics.

President Ferdinand "Bongbong" Marcos Jr. on Tuesday said he feels lucky that his wife, First Lady Liza Araneta-Marcos, is "very protective" of him.

item.title: Fire hits Parola compound in Manila
item.content:encoded:

The fire caused panic and chaos in the area. Firefighters were dispatched to the scene to control and extinguish the blaze. The incident highlights the importance of disaster risk reduction and proper management of emergencies in urban areas.

Summary:

A fire broke out in Parola compound in Manila on Tuesday noon, the city disaster risk reduction and management office said.

item.content:encoded: President Ferdinand "Bongbong" Marcos Jr. on Tuesday vowed to address the power supply problem in Occidental Mindoro.

item.title: Maynilad, Manila Water announce service interruptions in NCR, Rizal
item.content:encoded:
Maynilad, Manila Water, water interruptions, Metro Manila, Rizal
Maynilad and Manila Water, the water concessionaires in Metro Manila and Rizal, have announced upcoming water interruptions in various areas. Residents in these locations are advised to prepare accordingly and store enough water for their needs during the interruption periods. The scheduled water interruptions are necessary for maintenance and repair works to ensure the smooth operation of the water supply system. It is essential for affected residents to be aware of the specific schedules and duration of the interruptions to minimize inconveniences. Both Maynilad and Manila Water are working to complete the necessary tasks efficiently to restore the regular water supply as soon as possible. It is recommended for customers to follow updates from the concessionaires and take necessary precautions to manage their water usage during the interruption periods.

Summary:

Water concessionaires Maynilad and Manila Water have announced water interruptions in different parts of Metro Manila and Rizal

item.title: Lalaki sa Cagayan, patay matapos gawing pulutan ang butete
item.content:encoded:
Ballesteros, Cagayan, pufferfish, pulutan, butete
A man in Ballesteros, Cagayan died after allegedly using pufferfish as a snack. According to reports, the man made the pufferfish into pulutan, a type of snack commonly eaten with alcoholic beverages. Unfortunately, pufferfish contains toxins that can be deadly if not properly prepared. The man fell ill and eventually passed away after consuming the toxic fish. This incident serves as a reminder of the dangers of consuming poisonous seafood, especially if not prepared by trained individuals. It is crucial for people to be aware of the risks associated with consuming certain types of seafood and to always ensure that it has been properly prepared before consumption to avoid tragic incidents like this one. Awareness and education about the potential dangers of consuming certain foods can help prevent similar incidents from happening in the future.

Summary:

Patay ang isang lalaki sa Ballesteros, Cagayan matapos umanong gawing pulutan ang pufferfish o butete, ayon sa ulat ng Unang Balita mula sa GMA Regional TV One North Central Luzon nitong Martes.

item.title: GMA News Online reporter Ted Cordero among participants in 3-week US training
item.content:encoded:
senior news producer, Ted Cordero, GMA News Online, Filipino journalists, Friends, Partners, Allies

Ted Cordero, a senior news producer at GMA News Online, has been selected as one of the 10 Filipino journalists to participate in the groundbreaking Friends, Partners, Allies reporting tour in the US. This initiative aims to foster collaboration and strengthen ties between Filipino and American journalists. The tour will provide valuable opportunities for the participants to engage with their American counterparts, exchange ideas, and build lasting relationships. Cordero's selection highlights his expertise and dedication to quality journalism, showcasing his commitment to delivering accurate and informative news to audiences. This recognition also signifies the trust and respect that Cordero has earned among his peers in the journalism industry. This unique opportunity will not only enhance Cordero's professional skills but also contribute to the greater exchange of knowledge and perspectives between Filipino and American media professionals.

Summary: Ted Cordero, a senior news producer at GMA News Online, is one of 10 Filipino journalists selected to participate in the Friends, Partners, Allies reporting tour in the US, highlighting his expertise and dedication to quality journalism. The initiative aims to foster collaboration and strengthen ties between Filipino and American journalists, providing valuable opportunities for engagement and knowledge exchange. Cordero's selection showcases his commitment to delivering accurate news and signifies the trust and respect he has earned in the journalism industry, contributing to the greater exchange of knowledge and perspectives between Filipino and American media professionals.

GMA News Online"s senior news producer Ted Cordero is among the 10 Filipino journalists selected to participate in the pioneering Friends, Partners, Allies reporting tour in the US.

item.title: Taiwan rattled by dozens of quakes, but no major damage
item.content:encoded:
quake-hit, Hualien, aftershocks, damage, casualties Summary: Taiwan's quake-hit county of Hualien experienced dozens of aftershocks late on Monday and early Tuesday. Fortunately, only minor damage was reported, and there were no casualties. The tremors rattled the region but did not result in any significant harm. The county of Hualien, which had already been struck by a quake, continued to feel the impact of aftershocks. Despite the frequency of the aftershocks, the overall damage was minimal, and no casualties were reported. The residents of Hualien remained vigilant as the aftershocks occurred, but there were no major incidents. The aftershocks served as a reminder of the initial quake's impact, but the county managed to avoid any serious consequences from the subsequent tremors. The situation in Hualien was closely monitored, and efforts were made to ensure the safety of the residents amidst the aftershocks.

Taiwan's quake-hit county of Hualien was rattled by dozens of aftershocks late on Monday and early on Tuesday, but only minor was damage reported and no casualties.

item.title: Suspected BIFF leader, 11 others killed in Maguindanao clash --military
item.content:encoded:
BIFF, leader, encounter, killed, Maguindanao del Sur Summary: An alleged leader of the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters (BIFF) and 11 suspected members were killed in an encounter in Datu Saudi Ampatuan, Maguindanao del Sur on Monday. The military reported that the encounter resulted in the deaths of the alleged BIFF leader and 11 suspects. The incident took place in Datu Saudi Ampatuan, Maguindanao del Sur. The military operation targeted the BIFF group, resulting in casualties on both sides. The BIFF is known for its armed resistance against the government and has been involved in various clashes in the region. The encounter highlights the ongoing conflict between the government forces and armed groups in the area.

An alleged leader of the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters (BIFF) and 11 suspected members were killed in an encounter in Datu Saudi Ampatuan, Maguindanao del Sur on Monday, the military said.

item.title: Grassfire seen as possible cause of NAIA parking lot blaze
item.content:encoded:
NAIA, fire, cars, outdoor, pay parking area Summary: The fire that broke out in the outdoor pay parking area at NAIA was likely caused by a grassfire, according to airport management. The intense heat wave may have ignited the grass, leading to the cars catching fire. The incident resulted in significant damage to the vehicles parked in the area. Thankfully, there were no reports of injuries or casualties. The authorities are investigating the exact cause of the fire and are evaluating the safety measures in place to prevent such incidents in the future.

Summary:

The fire that burned cars in an outdoor pay parking area at NAIA may have been caused by a grassfire due to the extremely hot weather, airport management said.

item.title: 'Neutrality' issues found at UN agency for Palestinians, but no terrorism proof
item.content:encoded:
UN, Palestinians, review group, neutrality, Israel Summary: The independent review group investigating the UN agency for Palestinians found some neutrality-related issues but emphasized that Israel had not provided evidence for its accusations that agency staff were linked to terrorist organizations. The report, released on Monday, highlighted the need for a fair and impartial assessment of the agency's operations and staff. This review comes in the midst of ongoing tensions in the region and concerns about the treatment and support of Palestinian refugees. The report's findings suggest that while there are areas for improvement in terms of neutrality and accountability, there is no basis for the serious allegations made by Israel. It is crucial for all parties involved to uphold transparency and adhere to the principles of neutrality in order to ensure the effective delivery of aid and support to Palestinian refugees.

An independent review group on the UN agency for Palestinians found some "neutrality-related issues," its much-anticipated report said Monday, but noted Israel had yet to provide evidence for incendiary allegations that staff were members of terrorist organizations.

item.title: Biden unveils $7 billion for rooftop solar in Earth Day message
item.content:encoded:
Earth Day, President Joe Biden, $7 billion grants, residential solar projects, low-income households
Summary: President Joe Biden marked Earth Day by announcing $7 billion in grants for residential solar projects aimed at benefiting nearly a million low-income households. The grants will support the installation of solar panels in homes, reducing energy costs for families in need. This initiative aligns with Biden's commitment to combat climate change and promote clean energy sources. By investing in renewable energy, the US aims to reduce its carbon footprint and create a more sustainable future. The grants will not only provide financial assistance to low-income households but also contribute to the development of the solar industry, creating jobs and boosting the economy. Overall, this announcement illustrates the administration's dedication to environmental protection and social equity.

President Joe Biden on Monday celebrated Earth Day by announcing $7 billion in grants for residential solar projects that will power nearly a million low-income households.

item.title: North Korea's Kim guides nuclear counterattack simulation drills, KCNA says
item.content:encoded:
Kim Jong Un, North Korean leader, nuclear counterattack drills, warning, enemies.

Kim Jong Un, the leader of North Korea, has supervised nuclear counterattack exercises, issuing a clear threat to its adversaries, according to the state news agency KCNA. This demonstration serves as a stark reminder of North Korea's military capabilities and readiness to respond to potential threats. The drills are likely intended to showcase the regime's determination to defend itself against any perceived aggression, particularly from foreign adversaries. The message sent by Kim Jong Un's guidance of these exercises is one of defiance and strength, aimed at deterring any potential aggression and maintaining the regime's power and control. These actions further escalate tensions on the Korean Peninsula and raise concerns about the potential for conflict in the region. The international community closely monitors North Korea's actions and responses to evaluate the risk of further military escalation and its implications for regional security.

Summary:

North Korean leader Kim Jong Un has guided nuclear counterattack drills, sending a clear warning to its enemies, state news agency KCNA said on Tuesday.

item.title: White House weighs immigration relief for spouses of US citizens
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: White House, temporary legal status, work permits, immigrants, American citizens Summary: The White House is considering providing temporary legal status and work permits to immigrants who are married to American citizens and are residing in the U.S. illegally. This potential move could have significant implications for Democrats in the upcoming November elections, potentially energizing their base. By offering a pathway to legal status for these immigrants, it may garner support from immigrant advocacy groups and their allies, potentially boosting voter turnout. This policy shift could also signal a more lenient approach to immigration enforcement and align with President Biden's campaign promises to prioritize immigration reform. Overall, this proposal could bring relief to thousands of immigrants living in limbo and provide a pathway towards citizenship, potentially reshaping the political landscape surrounding immigration issues.

Summary:

The White House is weighing ways to provide temporary legal status and work permits to immigrants in the U.S. illegally who are married to American citizens, three sources familiar with the matter said on Monday, a move that could energize some Democrats ahead of the November elections.

item.title: 11-anyos na babae, pinatay at hinihinalang ginahasa pa; suspek, kamag-anak ng biktima
item.content:encoded:
nawawala, bangkay, Manukan, Zamboanga del Norte, ginahasa Summary: Authorities found the decaying body of an 11-year-old girl in a secluded area in Manukan, Zamboanga del Norte, days after she went missing. The authorities believe that the victim was also sexually assaulted.

Natagpuan sa masukal na lugar ang naaagnas na bangkay ng 11-anyos na babae na ilang araw nang nawawala sa Manukan, Zamboanga del Norte. Ang biktima, pinaniniwalaan ng mga awtoridad na ginahasa pa.

item.title: Self-rated poverty, hunger declines in the First Quarter of 2024 -- OCTA Survey
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: Self-rated poverty, Decreased, First Quarter 2024, 42%, TNM survey Summary: Self-rated poverty decreased in the First Quarter of 2024, with approximately 42% or 11.1 million Filipino families considering themselves poor. This data was gathered from the Tugon ng Masa (TNM) survey conducted by OCTA Research. The decrease in self-rated poverty indicates a positive trend in the economic well-being of Filipino households. The findings suggest that efforts to address poverty and improve living conditions may be showing some impact. It is essential to continue monitoring these trends to ensure sustained progress in reducing poverty levels and enhancing the overall quality of life for Filipino families. The TNM survey serves as a valuable tool for tracking changes in self-perceived poverty and gauging the effectiveness of poverty alleviation programs. The results of the survey provide valuable insights for policymakers and stakeholders in crafting strategies to further reduce poverty and enhance the welfare of the Filipino population.

Summary:

March 2024 First Quarter TUGON NG MASA (TNM) SurveSelf-rated poverty decreased in the First Quarter of 2024 with around 42% or about 11.1 million Filipino families who consider themselves poor, according to the Tugon ng Masa (TNM) survey results conducted by OCTA Research.y

item.title: Singer ng isang reggae band, binaril matapos mag-concert
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: bala, baril, bokalista, reggae band, Salay
Summary: A reggae band vocalist in Salay, Misamis Oriental met a tragic end as a bullet to the head took their life. The incident resulted in the untimely death of the talented singer, leaving fans and the music community in shock. The identity of the assailant and the motive behind the attack remain unknown, raising concerns about safety and security in the area. The deceased musician's bandmates and loved ones are devastated by the loss and are mourning the sudden departure. The local authorities have launched an investigation to uncover the truth behind the senseless act of violence, hoping to bring the perpetrator to justice and provide closure to the grieving family and friends. Such a tragic event serves as a reminder of the harsh realities of life and the importance of promoting peace and harmony in communities to prevent further tragedies like this from happening.

Summary:

Isang tama ng bala ng baril sa ulo ang tumapos sa buhay ng isang bokalista ng isang reggae band sa Salay, Misamis Oriental.

item.content:encoded: UNRWA has robust frameworks to ensure compliance with humanitarian neutrality principles, while Israel has yet to provide supporting evidence for its claims against it, says a report.
