item.title: More than 1.7 million persons affected by El Niño, DSWD says
item.content:encoded:
affected, El Niño, individuals, Department of Social Welfare and Development, million
At least 1.7 million individuals have been affected by the El Niño phenomenon, according to the Department of Social Welfare and Development. The department reported the impact on this large number of people as of Friday. The El Niño phenomenon has caused widespread devastation and difficulties for millions of individuals. The Department of Social Welfare and Development is working to provide assistance to those affected by the consequences of El Niño. The number of affected individuals continues to rise as the El Niño phenomenon progresses, highlighting the urgent need for support and aid in the affected areas.

Summary:

At least 1.7 million individuals have already been affected by the El Niño phenomenon as of Friday, the Department of Social Welfare and Development said Saturday.

item.title: Phreatic eruptions observed at Taal Volcano -- OCD
item.content:encoded:
eruptions, Taal Volcano, Batangas, Steam-driven, phreatic
Summary: Steam-driven or phreatic eruptions were observed on Saturday morning at Taal Volcano in Batangas, as reported by the Office of Civil Defense (OCD). These eruptions are characterized by the release of steam and other volcanic gases rather than lava. The phenomenon was identified at the volcano, leading to increased monitoring and warnings issued by authorities. Taal Volcano, known for its picturesque crater lake, had been showing signs of increased activity in recent weeks. The occurrence of these eruptions serves as a reminder of the potential hazards posed by active volcanoes in the region. Authorities continue to closely monitor the situation and provide updates to ensure the safety of residents and visitors in the vicinity of Taal Volcano.
Summary:

Steam-driven or phreatic eruptions have been observed on Saturday morning at Taal Volcano in Batangas, the Office of Civil Defense (OCD) reported in separate advisories.

item.title: Luzon grid on yellow alert 6-10 PM, NGCP says
item.content:encoded:
grid, Luzon, yellow alert, National Grid Corporation of the Philippines, 6 to 10 p.m.
Summary: The National Grid Corporation of the Philippines announced that the Luzon grid will be under a yellow alert from 6 to 10 p.m. today. This alert indicates that the power supply may be insufficient to meet the demand during that period. The grid operator urges consumers to conserve electricity to prevent outages. The National Grid Corporation of the Philippines manages the transmission of electricity across the country and issues alerts to ensure the stability of the power supply. The yellow alert serves as a warning for possible power shortages, prompting households and businesses to use electricity wisely. The announcement underscores the importance of energy conservation to avoid overloading the grid and mitigate the risk of blackouts during peak hours. It is essential for residents and industries to cooperate by reducing electricity consumption to maintain the reliability of the power system.


The National Grid Corporation of the Philippines on Saturday said the Luzon grid will be placed on yellow alert from 6 to 10 p.m. today.

item.title: Fire breaks out in residential area in Brgy. Plainview, Mandaluyong
item.content:encoded:
Barangay Plainview, Mandaluyong City, fire, residential area, Saturday morning Summary:

A fire broke out in a residential area in Barangay Plainview, Mandaluyong City on Saturday morning. The incident caused panic among residents as firefighters worked to contain the blaze. The fire quickly spread through the neighborhood, damaging several homes and causing widespread destruction. Thankfully, no casualties were reported, but many families were left homeless as their houses were engulfed in flames. Authorities are investigating the cause of the fire and providing assistance to those affected by the disaster. The community is coming together to support the victims and help them rebuild their lives after this devastating event.

A fire hit a residential area in Barangay Plainview, Mandaluyong City on Saturday morning.

item.title: Two hurt in fire in residential area in Brgy. Sto. Niño, QC
item.content:encoded: Two people were injured after a fire hit a residential area in Barangay Sto. Niño, Quezon City on Saturday morning.

item.title: US military strategy tested as Iran-Israel warfare comes out of shadows
item.content:encoded:
US military, Israel, Iran, missiles, drones
The US military's successful intervention in helping Israel thwart a major Iranian missile and drone onslaught signals Washington's readiness for potential future clashes between Iran and Israel. This recent direct confrontation highlights the shifting dynamics from covert operations to overt hostilities. The US military's assistance in halting the Iranian threat showcases a strong defense capability and strategic partnership with Israel. The success in neutralizing the Iranian threat underscores the effectiveness of coordinated military efforts between the US and its allies. As tensions escalate between Iran and Israel, the US military's support demonstrates a proactive approach to addressing regional security challenges.

Summary:

The US military's success helping Israel stop a massive wave of Iranian missiles and drones last weekend might suggest Washington is well prepared militarily for whatever comes next as Iran and Israel move from shadow warfare to direct confrontation.

item.title: North Korea conducts cruise missile warhead test on Friday, KCNA says
item.content:encoded:
cruise missile, warhead test, anti-aircraft missile, North Korea, West Sea of Korea
Summary: North Korea conducted a cruise missile warhead test and test launch of its new anti-aircraft missile in the West Sea of Korea on Friday, as reported by the North's KCNA news agency. The missile test activities are concerning as they demonstrate North Korea's continued efforts to enhance its military capabilities. The cruise missile warhead test indicates progress in developing advanced weaponry, potentially posing a threat to regional security. Additionally, the test launch of the anti-aircraft missile suggests North Korea's focus on enhancing its air defense capabilities. The ongoing missile tests highlight the need for close monitoring and diplomatic efforts to address North Korea's missile development program, preventing escalation of tensions in the region.

North Korea conducted a cruise missile warhead test and test launch of its new anti-aircraft missile in the West Sea of Korea on Friday, the North's KCNA news agency said on Saturday.

item.title: Iran signals no plan to retaliate against Israel after drone attack
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: explosions, Iranian city, Israeli attack, Tehran, retaliation Summary: Explosions were heard in an Iranian city on Friday, believed to be a result of an Israeli attack. Despite the incident, Tehran downplayed the situation and stated that it had no plans for retaliation. This response was likely aimed at preventing a larger conflict in the region. The attack and subsequent response highlight the tense relationship between Iran and Israel. The incident also raises concerns about the potential for escalation in the ongoing conflict between the two countries. Overall, the situation underscores the delicate balance of power in the Middle East and the ongoing risk of conflict erupting in the region.

Explosions echoed over an Iranian city on Friday in what sources said was an Israeli attack, but Tehran played down the incident and indicated it had no plans for retaliation - a response that appeared gauged towards averting region-wide war.

item.title: WHO approves simpler cholera vaccine
item.content:encoded:
WHO, new vaccine, oral cholera, doses, increase Summary: The World Health Organization (WHO) has approved a new version of an existing oral cholera vaccine to help boost the number of available doses as global cases of cholera continue to rise. This new version is simpler to administer, making it easier to distribute and use in affected areas. By increasing the availability of the vaccine, WHO aims to tackle the surging number of cholera cases worldwide. The approval of this new vaccine will play a crucial role in efforts to control and prevent the spread of this deadly disease.WHO's decision to expand access to this oral cholera vaccine will help in the fight against cholera outbreaks and save lives in the process.

Summary:

The World Health Organization (WHO) announced Friday it had approved a new, simpler version of an existing oral cholera vaccine, which should help increase the number of available doses as global cases surge.

item.title: Japan court denies fishing rights to Ainu people
item.content:encoded:
Dismissed, Japan, Ainu Indigenous people, river fishing, salmon Summary: A court in Japan has dismissed a bid by the Ainu Indigenous people to reclaim rights over river fishing for salmon. The Ainu people, indigenous to northern Japan, had sought to regain control over fishing rights in the country's Hokkaido region. The court ruling denied their claims, stating that the Ainu people did not have exclusive rights to fishing in the region. This decision is a setback for the Ainu community, who have long fought for recognition of their cultural and land rights. The Ainu people have faced discrimination and marginalization in Japan, and this ruling further highlights the challenges they continue to face in asserting their rights as an indigenous group. Despite the court's decision, the Ainu people are likely to continue their struggle for recognition and rights in Japan.

Summary:

A court in Japan dismissed a bid by Ainu Indigenous people to reclaim rights over river fishing for salmon, an official said Thursday.

item.title: Itlog, puwede nga bang maluto sa ilalim ng sikat ng araw?
item.content:encoded:
social media, post, cooking, sun, egg
Summary: There is a trend on social media where posts depict cooking or frying food items, such as eggs, solely using the heat from the sun. This concept raises skepticism regarding its validity. While it is true that the sun emits heat, it is not enough to cook food thoroughly or safely. Cooking food requires specific temperatures to kill bacteria and toxins that can be present in raw ingredients like eggs. Additionally, the sun's heat may not provide consistent or regulated temperatures needed for cooking. Therefore, relying solely on solar heat for cooking purposes is not recommended and can pose health risks. Despite the creative and innovative idea showcased in these posts, it is essential to follow traditional cooking methods using appropriate equipment and heat sources to ensure food safety and quality.

Uso ngayon sa social media ang mga post na nagpapakita na nakapagluluto o nakakapagprito umano sa pamamagitan lang ng sikat ng araw--gaya ng itlog. Pero totoo nga kaya ito? Alamin.

item.title: Woman loses cellphone to 'punas-tissue' in Batangas City
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: Batangas City, woman, lost, cellphone, passenger Summary: In Batangas City, a woman fell victim to a theft on a jeepney when a fellow passenger distracted her by pointing out dirt on her shoulder, resulting in the theft of her cellphone. The unsuspecting woman's attention was diverted momentarily while the thief took advantage of the situation and made off with her device. The incident serves as a reminder of the importance of staying vigilant and cautious, especially in public transportation settings where thefts can easily occur. Authorities have been notified of the theft, but caution and awareness among passengers remain crucial in preventing such incidents. The woman's unfortunate experience highlights the need for vigilance and awareness of one's belongings to avoid falling prey to thieves and scams in crowded public places.

Summary:

A woman in Batangas City lost her cellphone to a fellow jeepney passenger who told her she had dirt on her shoulder.

item.title: Lalaki, patay matapos barilin ng 'sumpak' ng 15-anyos na suspek sa Sorsogon
item.content:encoded:
18-anyos, lalaki, barilin, 15-anyos, sumpak Summary: An 18-year-old male was shot and killed by a 15-year-old suspect using a "sumpak" in Sorsogon City. The victim succumbed to his injuries, and the 15-year-old suspect has been apprehended by authorities. The incident is a tragic example of youth violence that has resulted in a senseless loss of life. The motive behind the shooting remains unclear, but the police are conducting an investigation to determine the circumstances that led to the deadly altercation. The use of firearms by minors underscores the need for stricter gun control measures to prevent such tragedies from happening in the future. The community is left mourning the untimely death of the young victim and grappling with the repercussions of this senseless act of violence. The tragic incident serves as a reminder of the importance of promoting peace and conflict resolution to prevent similar tragedies from occurring.

Patay ang isang 18-anyos na lalaki matapos siyang barilin ng 15-anyos na suspek gamit ang isang "sumpak" sa Sorsogon City.

item.title: P5-M halaga ng alahas ng namatay na amo, tinangay umano ng caregiver; suspek, nadakip
item.content:encoded: Dinakip ang isang caregiver matapos na nakawin umano nito ang mga alahas ng kaniyang namatay na amo na nagkakahalaga ng P5 milyon.

item.title: Mga Pinoy sa Israel, pinaghahanda umano sakaling lumalala ang hidwaan ng bansa sa Iran
item.content:encoded:
Israel, Iran, drone bombs, missiles, conflict
Summary:
After Iran recently launched drone bombs and missiles on Israel, Israel retaliated by releasing drones on Iran. This escalation in tensions between the two countries has prompted warnings to Filipino residents in Israel to be prepared in case the situation worsens. The exchange of attacks is a concerning development that has the potential to escalate further and impact both countries significantly. The use of drones in warfare is adding a new dimension to regional conflicts and posing a serious threat to stability in the region. The Filipino community in Israel is being urged to stay informed and take necessary precautions to ensure their safety amidst the growing hostilities between Iran and Israel.

Matapos magpaulan ng drone bombs at missiles ang Iran sa Israel kamakailan, ang Israel naman ang nagpapakawala ng mga drone sa Iran. Kaya ang mga Pinoy sa Israel, pinaalalahanan na sakaling lumalala ang sigalot ng dalawang bansa.

item.title: 1 sa 3 OFW na nasawi sa Dubai, UAE noong kasagsagan ng ulan at baha, nahulog sa sinkhole
item.content:encoded:
OWWA, Overseas Workers Welfare Administration, labi, OFW, Dubai Summary: The Overseas Workers Welfare Administration (OWWA) is currently assisting in repatriating the remains of three overseas Filipino workers who tragically lost their lives during heavy rain and flooding in Dubai, United Arab Emirates. OWWA is coordinating all necessary arrangements to bring the bodies back to the Philippines. The deceased OFWs were caught in the midst of the intense rainfall and flooding in Dubai, which resulted in their untimely deaths. OWWA is ensuring that the necessary paperwork and procedures are completed for the repatriation process. The tragic incident serves as a reminder of the risks that Filipino workers face while working abroad, especially during natural disasters. The families of the deceased OFWs are being provided with support and assistance during this difficult time. The OWWA's swift response and efforts to bring the remains of the OFWs back to their homeland highlight their commitment to safeguarding the welfare of overseas Filipino workers.

Inaasikaso na ng Overseas Workers Welfare Administration (OWWA) ang mga kailangang gawin upang maiuwi sa Pilipinas ang mga labi ng tatlong overseas Filipino worker na nasawi sa kasagsagan ng pag-ulan at pagbaha sa Dubai, United Arab Emirates.

item.title: 2 batang magkapatid na nasawi sa sunog sa Cavite, natagpuang magkayakap sa natupok nilang bahay
item.content:encoded:
batang, magkayakap, labi, magkapatid, Silang Cavite Summary: The bodies of two young sibling were found hugging inside their burned home in Silang, Cavite on Thursday. The tragic discovery was made after the fire was put out, revealing the heartbreaking scene of the children embracing each other in their final moments. The authorities are investigating the cause of the fire and trying to determine what led to the devastating incident. Family members and neighbors are in shock and mourning the loss of the children, whose identities have not been disclosed yet. The community has come together to support the grieving family and offer help in any way they can during this difficult time. The heartbreaking image of the siblings holding each other in death has left a deep impact on the local residents and serves as a reminder of the fragility of life.

Natagpuan na magkayakap ang mga labi ng dalawang batang magkapatid sa loob ng nasunog nilang bahay sa Silang, Cavite nitong Huwebes.

item.title: Liza Marcos on avoiding VP Sara: 'I'm not a hypocrite'
item.content:encoded:
keywords: First Lady Liza Araneta Marcos, Vice President Sara Duterte, snubbing, animosity, relationship Summary: First Lady Liza Araneta Marcos has admitted to snubbing Vice President Sara Duterte due to feelings of animosity, but has not completely closed the door on the possibility of mending their relationship in the future. This revelation sheds light on the strained relationship between the two prominent figures in Philippine politics. Despite the tension between them, there is still a glimmer of hope for reconciliation. The public nature of their rift adds a layer of complexity to their interactions and raises questions about the dynamics of power and influence in the political landscape. Only time will tell if these two women can set aside their differences and find common ground for the betterment of the country. The nuanced nature of their relationship highlights the challenges and complexities of navigating the world of politics, where personal feelings and professional responsibilities often intersect. It remains to be seen how this feud will play out in the larger context of Philippine politics.

Summary:

First Lady Liza Araneta Marcos has revealed that she has been snubbing Vice President Sara Duterte to show her animosity, but is leaving the door open that their relationship could still be mended.

item.title: 3 Comelec officials inspect counting machine plant in Korea
item.content:encoded:
Comelec, commissioners, South Korea, Miru Systems Company Limited, automated counting machines Summary:
Three Comelec commissioners traveled to South Korea to inspect the automated counting machines being built by Miru Systems Company Limited for the 2025 midterm elections. The commissioners were ensuring the machines were being developed according to specifications and standards. The visit aimed to ensure the integrity and accuracy of the election process using the new technology. The trip signified the Comelec's commitment to upholding fair and transparent elections by investing in advanced technology. By personally assessing the progress of the machines, the commissioners were taking proactive measures to prevent any potential issues during the upcoming elections.

Three Comelec commissioners flew to South Korea to check on the automated counting machines that Miru Systems Company Limited was building for the 2025 midterm elections.

item.title: 1-year-old baby from Cagayan with malignant tumor begins chemotherapy
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: one-year-old, Cagayan, tumor, treatment, face

A one-year-old baby from Cagayan is currently receiving treatment for a sudden tumor growth on his face. The family of the infant is seeking assistance to cover the costs of the medical expenses. The tumor's rapid development has caused distress to the child and his family, prompting them to seek help from the community. The baby's condition highlights the need for financial support and medical intervention to address the alarming health concern. The situation emphasizes the importance of early detection and prompt medical attention to prevent further complications and alleviate the suffering of the child. The family's plea for help underscores the significance of accessible healthcare services and financial aid for individuals facing critical health issues. The community's response and support are crucial in aiding the child's recovery and ensuring that he receives the necessary treatment and care.

Summary: The one-year-old from Cagayan is undergoing treatment for a sudden tumor growth on his face, with his family seeking financial assistance to cover the medical expenses. The distress caused by the rapid development highlights the importance of early detection and prompt medical intervention to prevent complications. The situation underscores the need for accessible healthcare services and financial aid for individuals facing critical health issues.

A one-year-old baby from Cagayan is now undergoing treatment for the tumor that suddenly grew on his face.

item.title: Father and son nabbed for illegal sale of firearms in Antipolo
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: man, son, Antipolo City, illegal sale, car repair shop
Summary:
A man and his son were apprehended in Antipolo City for allegedly engaging in the illegal sale of firearms and ammunition from their car repair shop. The authorities conducted a raid in response to a tip-off and found an assortment of firearms and ammunition in their possession. The father and son duo were taken into custody for further investigation. The operation highlighted the diligence of law enforcement in cracking down on illegal activities that pose a threat to public safety. The incident serves as a reminder of the importance of stringent regulations and enforcement to prevent the proliferation of illegal firearms in the community.
Summary:

A man and his son were nabbed in Antipolo City for the alleged illegal sale of firearms and ammunition in their car repair shop.

item.title: May katumbas nga bang halaga ang kasiyahan o kaligayahan ng tao?
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: pag-aaral, Pilipino, sahod, masaya, pera Summary: A study suggests that Filipinos need to earn P110,000 per month to be happy. This raises the question of whether money is the key to happiness for individuals. The study implies that financial stability plays a significant role in one's overall satisfaction with life. However, it is essential to consider that happiness is subjective and can be influenced by various factors beyond financial means. While a higher salary may contribute to a sense of security and comfort, true happiness may stem from meaningful relationships, personal fulfillment, and emotional well-being. Ultimately, achieving happiness is a complex and multifaceted endeavor that goes beyond mere monetary considerations.

Batay sa isang pag-aaral, dapat nasa P110,000 kada buwan ang sahod ng mga Pilipino para maging masaya. Nasa pera nga ba ang kasagutan para maging masaya ang isang tao?

item.title: El Niño damage to agriculture nears P4 billion -- DA
item.content:encoded:
Department of Agriculture, losses, damage, El Niño phenomenon, nearly P4 billion
Summary: The Department of Agriculture has reported that losses and damage to the country's agriculture sector from the El Niño phenomenon have totaled nearly P4 billion. This significant financial impact underscores the severity of the situation, highlighting the need for immediate response and support. The ongoing effects of El Niño on agriculture pose a serious threat to food security and livelihoods in the country. The Department of Agriculture may need to implement mitigation measures and provide assistance to affected farmers to help them recover from the losses incurred. It is crucial for the government and relevant authorities to prioritize the agricultural sector and work towards building resilience to future climate-related challenges.


Losses and damage to the country's agriculture sector resulting from the El Niño phenomenon has reached nearly P4 billion, the Department of Agriculture (DA) said Friday.

item.title: Dubai airport limits arriving flights amid storm backlog
item.content:encoded: DUBAI - Dubai's main airport said on Friday it is limiting the number of flights arriving for two days, as it continues to struggle to clear a backlog three days after a record storm swept the United Arab Emirates.

item.content:encoded: Close to one million children aged six months to below 10 years old in the Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao are now immunized against measles, according to the Department of Health (DOH).

item.content:encoded: DUBAI/JERUSALEM - Explosions echoed over an Iranian city on Friday in what sources described as an Israeli attack, but Tehran played down the incident and indicated it had no plans for retaliation - a response that appeared gauged towards averting region-wide war.

item.title: Waterpark na nasa loob ng mall, matatagpuan sa Taguig
item.content:encoded:
waterpark, Taguig, pool, beach, mall Summary: In Taguig, there is a waterpark located inside a mall where people can enjoy swimming without the need to go out of town. This convenient location is perfect for those who are looking to relax and have fun in a pool-like setting. The waterpark offers a variety of amenities and activities for visitors to enjoy, making it a great alternative to a beach or resort. With its location inside a mall, it is easily accessible and provides a unique experience for guests looking for a quick getaway. Whether you want to cool off in the pool, relax on the beach-like area, or simply enjoy some time in the water, this waterpark in Taguig is the perfect destination for a fun and relaxing day.

Sa mga gusto nang mag-swimming sa pool o beach pero wala pang time para mag-out of town, may isang waterpark sa Taguig na puwedeng puntahan at nasa loob ng isang mall.

item.title: Raymond Almazan, itinangging tinangka nilang suhulan ang sumita sa kanila sa EDSA Busway
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: Raymond Almazan, EDSA Busway, professional basketball player, misunderstanding, bribery Summary: Raymond Almazan, a professional basketball player, admitted that he mistakenly drove through the EDSA Busway, but denied allegations that he and his wife attempted to bribe the authorities who accosted them. Almazan clarified that they were not aware of the bus lane rules and apologized for the error. The incident caused a misunderstanding, leading to the involvement of authorities. However, Almazan emphasized that they had no intention of bribing the enforcers and were cooperative throughout the encounter. This clarification from Almazan sheds light on the situation and highlights the importance of understanding traffic regulations to avoid similar incidents in the future. Almazan's admission of fault and denial of bribery attempts showcase a willingness to take responsibility for the mistake while maintaining integrity in their interactions with law enforcement.

Aminado ang professional basketball player na si Raymond Almazan na mali ang pagdaan niya sa EDSA Busway pero hindi umano totoo na tinangka nila ng kaniyang asawa na suhulan ang mga sumita sa kanila.

item.title: Airlines reroute flights after Israeli attack on Iran
item.content:encoded:
flight paths, Iran, diverted, alternate airports, Israeli attack
Summary: Airlines made swift changes to their flight paths over Iran, diverting to alternate airports or returning to their departure points following an Israeli attack. This response came after airspace and airport closures were imposed. Flight tracking data showed the quick actions taken by airlines to ensure the safety and security of their passengers. The Israeli attack prompted the closures and forced airlines to make immediate adjustments to their travel routes. This demonstrates the importance of being prepared for unforeseen events and having contingency plans in place. The situation highlights the complexity and potential risks involved in international air travel, with airlines needing to react quickly and efficiently to unexpected disruptions.

Airlines quickly changed flight paths over Iran, diverted to alternate airports or returned planes to their departure points on Friday in response to airspace and airport closures after an Israeli attack on Iran, flight tracking data showed.

item.title: Liza Marcos on running for Senate: Parang ang layo niyan
item.content:encoded:
dismissed, speculations, preparing, Senate, outreach Summary: First Lady Liza Araneta-Marcos has dismissed speculations about preparing to run for the Senate amid her recent participation in an outreach program. She has denied any intention to enter the political arena and emphasized her focus on initiatives that aim to help communities in need. Despite her involvement in public service activities, she has made it clear that her current priority is supporting her family and husband, who is a prominent political figure. The rumors surrounding her potential candidacy for the Senate have been refuted, with the First Lady stating that she remains committed to her role as a supportive spouse rather than pursuing a political career. Her participation in the outreach program was a testament to her dedication to social causes and community welfare, rather than an indication of a forthcoming political campaign.

First Lady Liza Araneta-Marcos has dismissed speculations that she is preparing to run for the Senate amid her recent participation in an outreach program.

item.title: P3.4-M suspected shabu seized in Cotabato City
item.content:encoded:
drug suspects, P3.4 million, Cotabato City, shabu, sting operation Summary: In a sting operation conducted in Cotabato City, police arrested four drug suspects and seized suspected shabu valued at around P3.4 million on Almonte Street, Poblacion 2. The operation resulted in the successful capture of individuals involved in drug trafficking in the area, demonstrating law enforcement's commitment to combating illegal drug activities in the region. The sizable amount of shabu confiscated highlights the significant impact of the operation in disrupting the drug trade and preventing the distribution of dangerous substances in the community. The seizure of such a large quantity of drugs underscores the severity of the issue of illegal drug trafficking in the area and the importance of continued efforts to address and prevent its proliferation. The successful operation serves as a testament to the dedication and effectiveness of the police force in carrying out operations to maintain law and order and ensure the safety of the public.

Summary:

Police seized suspected shabu worth around P3.4 million and arrested four drug suspects in a sting operation on Almonte Street, Poblacion 2, Cotabato City.

item.title: ASEAN 'deeply concerned' by escalating Myanmar violence
item.content:encoded:
ASEAN, regional bloc, Myanmar, upsurge in fighting, clashes
Summary: ASEAN, the regional bloc, has expressed deep concern over the recent increase in fighting in Myanmar. The clashes in a key trading hub on the Thai border have escalated tensions in the region. Myanmar's instability is a major cause for worry for ASEAN, as the violence threatens the peace and stability of the region. The upsurge in fighting has raised alarms among member nations, prompting calls for a peaceful resolution to the conflict. ASEAN's statement reflects the urgent need for a peaceful resolution to the crisis in Myanmar to prevent further escalations and ensure the security and well-being of its people.
Summary:

Regional bloc ASEAN said it is "deeply concerned" about a recent upsurge in fighting in Myanmar, after fierce clashes over a key trading hub on the Thai border.

item.title: DOE: Power lost due to outages more than double the four-year average
item.content:encoded:
Department of Energy, power supply, unplanned outages, 1,811 megawatts, double
Summary:
The Department of Energy reported that the power supply lost due to unplanned outages of power plants this week reached 1,811 megawatts, which is more than double compared to the average of the last four years. This significant loss of power supply highlights the vulnerability of the energy infrastructure and the need for better contingency planning. Unplanned outages can disrupt the reliability of the power grid, leading to potential energy shortages and increased risk of blackouts. Addressing the root causes of these outages, such as equipment failures or maintenance issues, is crucial to ensuring a stable and consistent power supply for consumers. The DOE's findings underscore the importance of investing in infrastructure upgrades and implementing measures to prevent unplanned outages in the future.
Summary:

The power supply lost due to unplanned outages of power plants this week reached 1,811 megawatts or more than double compared with the average in the last four years, the Department of Energy (DOE) said Friday.

item.title: Marcos urges new PNPA grads: Use technology to fight crimes, serve Filipinos
item.content:encoded:
uniformed personnel, Philippine National Police Academy, technology, crimes, Filipino people Summary: President Ferdinand "Bongbong" Marcos Jr. encouraged the 223 new uniformed personnel from the PNPA "Layag-Diwa" Class of 2024 to utilize technology effectively in combatting crimes and serving the Filipino population. He emphasized the importance of embracing technological advancements to enhance law enforcement efforts and ensure public safety. By integrating modern tools and techniques into their operations, the new graduates can contribute significantly to the mission of maintaining law and order in the country. President Marcos urged the new officers to stay committed to their duties and prioritize the welfare of the Filipino people in their service. He expressed confidence in their abilities to make a positive impact in the field of law enforcement by harnessing the power of technology for the greater good.

President Ferdinand "Bongbong" Marcos Jr. on Friday urged the 223 new uniformed personnel under the Philippine National Police Academy (PNPA) "Layag-Diwa" Class of 2024 to maximize technology in fighting crimes and serving the Filipino people.

item.title: MMDA eyes canceling tickets, returning impounded e-bikes
item.content:encoded: The MMDA is planning to cancel the tickets and return the impounded vehicles of violators of the ban on e-bikes and e-trikes.

item.title: Free MRT3, LRT2 rides for solo parents on April 20
item.content:encoded:
MRT3, LRT2, Single parents, Free rides, Solo Parents' Day Summary: Single parents can enjoy complimentary rides on MRT3 and LRT2 on April 20, Saturday, as part of the Solo Parents' Day celebration. This initiative aims to recognize and support the efforts of single parents who face the challenges of raising children alone. The free rides provide a gesture of appreciation for their hard work and dedication. By offering this special promotion, public transportation authorities are showing their solidarity with single parents and acknowledging the importance of their role in society. It's a thoughtful way to give back to those who work tirelessly to provide for their families and enrich the lives of their children. This opportunity allows single parents to travel conveniently and hassle-free on their special day, contributing to a more inclusive and supportive community for all.

Single parents may avail of free rides on MRT3 and LRT2 on April 20, Saturday, in celebration of Solo Parents' Day.

item.title: TIMELINE: Iran and Israel's open warfare after decades of shadow war
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: Israel, Iran, strike, soil, shadow war Summary: Israel conducted a strike on Iranian soil on Friday, intensifying the ongoing conflict between the two long-standing regional adversaries. This latest incident is part of a broader shadow war that has been escalating in recent years, marking a significant departure from covert operations to open hostilities. The tit-for-tat exchanges between Israel and Iran have become more frequent, with both sides engaging in retaliatory actions and escalating tensions in the region. The strike on Iranian soil is a bold move by Israel and could have serious implications for the already volatile situation in the Middle East. As the conflict between Israel and Iran continues to unfold, the region faces the risk of further instability and conflict.

Israel launched a strike on Iranian soil on Friday, sources said, in the latest of the tit-for-tat exchanges between the regional arch foes whose long-running shadow war has broken into the open.

item.title: Foreign students may be subjected to intel probe --BI
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: student visas, foreign nationals, government intelligence investigation, activities, security of the State Summary:

Foreign nationals holding student visas in the Philippines may undergo government intelligence scrutiny for engaging in activities deemed threatening to national security, as announced by the Bureau of Immigration. This measure is intended to safeguard the State from potential risks posed by foreign students residing in the country. The BI is empowered to conduct investigations on individuals exhibiting behaviors that could compromise the security and stability of the nation. The initiative aims to prevent any activities that may be detrimental to the interests of the State and its citizens. Foreign students are advised to adhere to the laws and regulations of the Philippines to avoid being flagged for examination by immigration authorities.

Summary:

Foreign nationals with student visas may be subjected to government intelligence investigation for activities that “appear to be inimical to the security of the State,” the Bureau of Immigration (BI) said Friday.

item.title: Marcos pushes for increased internet connectivity for MSMEs, nano-enterprises
item.content:encoded: Marcos pushes for increased President Ferdinand "Bongbong" Marcos Jr. on Friday highlighted the need for increased internet connectivity in the Philippines to bring micro, small, medium enterprises (MSMEs) and nano-enterprises to the digital space.internet connectivity for MSMEs, nano-enterprises

item.title: UPCAT results for AY 2024-2025 out
item.content:encoded: The results of the University of the Philippines College Admission Test (UPCAT) for Academic Year (AY) 2024-2025 were released Friday.

item.title: Trabahador, patay nang ma-trap sa nasusunog na tindahan ng LPG sa Caloocan
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: trabahador, nasusunog, tindahan, LPG, North Caloocan Summary: A worker tragically died after being trapped in a burning LPG store in Barangay 176 in North Caloocan. The incident was reported by James Agustin in Unang Balita. The fire engulfed the store, leading to the tragic death of the worker. The cause of the fire is still under investigation. The incident serves as a reminder of the dangers associated with handling flammable materials like LPG. The community is mourning the loss of the worker and is concerned about the safety measures in place in similar establishments to prevent such tragedies from happening again. The authorities are working to determine the cause of the fire and ensure that necessary safety measures are in place in all establishments dealing with flammable materials.

Patay ang isang trabahador matapos ma-trap sa nasusunog na tindahan ng LPG sa Barangay 176 sa North Caloocan, ayon sa ulat ni James Agustin sa Unang Balita nitong Biyernes.

item.title: DENR promotes urban green spaces to ease heat index
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: DENR, urban green spaces, high heat index, promotion, establishment Summary: DENR, the Department of Environment and Natural Resources, is actively advocating for the creation of urban green spaces in an effort to combat the rising high heat index observed in the country. Recognizing the detrimental effects of increasing temperatures on the environment and human health, DENR is promoting the establishment of green areas within urban settings as a solution. These green spaces can help mitigate the impact of the high heat index by providing shade, cooling effects, and improving air quality. By increasing green infrastructure in urban areas, DENR aims to create more sustainable and resilient cities that can better cope with the challenges of climate change. Through encouraging the development of urban green spaces, DENR is taking proactive steps towards enhancing the well-being of communities and fostering a healthier environment for all.

DENR is promoting the establishment of urban green spaces to mitigate the increasing high heat index in the country.

item.title: NGCP: Luzon grid under red, yellow alerts; Visayas grid under yellow alert
item.content:encoded:
power supply, Luzon, Visayas, red alert, yellow alert Summary:
The power supply situation in Luzon and Visayas grids remains tight for the fourth consecutive day. Both grids will experience red and yellow alerts on Friday afternoon until evening. The alerts indicate a potential power shortage and a call for consumers to conserve electricity. This ongoing issue highlights the strained power resources in the regions, prompting authorities to closely monitor the energy consumption to avoid disruptions. Consumers are urged to practice energy efficiency and reduce electricity usage during peak hours to alleviate the strain on the grids. The situation underscores the importance of sustainable energy practices and the need for long-term solutions to address the power supply challenges in the Luzon and Visayas grids.

The tight power supply situation in the Luzon and Visayas power grids continues for the fourth straight day as both grids will be placed under red and yellow alerts on Friday afternoon until evening.

item.title: Cagayan colleges, universities dismiss reports on influx of Chinese students
item.content:encoded:
higher education institutions, Cagayan, Chinese students, influx, denial Summary: Private higher education institutions in Cagayan have refuted reports claiming a surge in Chinese students in the province. Despite the rumors, these institutions have stated that there has been no significant increase in the number of Chinese students enrolling in their programs. The institutions have clarified that they have strict admission procedures in place and do not prioritize or favor any specific nationality in their student selection process. They emphasized that their primary focus is on providing quality education to all students, regardless of their nationality. The denial of the influx of Chinese students highlights the institutions' commitment to maintaining a diverse and inclusive learning environment for all students.

Private higher education institutions in Cagayan have denied reports on the supposed influx of Chinese students in the province.

item.title: Nahuling sawa na mahigit 10 feet ang haba, nakawala sa QC
item.content:encoded:
Barangay Talayan, Quezon City, sawang, 10 talampakan, James Agustin
Summary: A python measuring over 10 feet was captured in Barangay Talayan, Quezon City, as reported by James Agustin on Unang Balita. The snake was found in the area and caught by the authorities. The snake's length exceeded 10 feet, making it a significant discovery in the barangay. Authorities responded promptly to ensure the safety of the residents and the snake. James Agustin provided detailed coverage of the incident on Unang Balita, highlighting the importance of wildlife awareness and proper handling of such situations. Barangay Talayan now stands vigilant against potential wildlife threats, ensuring the community's safety.

Isang sawang mahigit 10 talampakan ang haba ang nahuli sa Barangay Talayan sa Quezon City, ayon sa ulat ni James Agustin sa Unang Balita nitong Biyernes.

item.title: 15 estudyante sa Albay, sugatan matapos bumigay ang dinaraanang tulay
item.content:encoded:
students, collapsed bridge, Camanitohan River, Manito, Albay Summary: Fifteen students were injured after the bridge they were crossing over the Camanitohan River in Manito, Albay collapsed. The incident was reported by Unang Balita on Friday. The students were presumably crossing the bridge when it gave way, causing them to fall into the river below. It is not clear what caused the bridge to collapse, but the local authorities are investigating the incident. The injured students were immediately rushed to the hospital for medical treatment. The collapse of the bridge has raised concerns about the safety of other bridges in the area, prompting officials to conduct thorough inspections to prevent similar incidents from happening in the future.

Sugatan ang 15 estudyante matapos bumigay ang dinaraanan nilang tulay sa Camanitohan River sa Manito, Albay, ayon sa ulat ng Unang Balita nitong Biyernes.

item.title: Forest fire erupts in Mt. Arayat, Pampanga
item.content:encoded: Residents near Mt. Arayat in Pampanga were alarmed upon seeing a portion of the mountain ablaze

item.title: US stops UN from recognizing a Palestinian state through membership
item.content:encoded:
United States, United Nations, Palestinian state, veto, Security Council

The United States used its veto power in the United Nations Security Council to prevent the Palestinian Authority from gaining full membership in the world body. This move effectively halted the UN from recognizing a Palestinian state. The decision by the US to cast a veto thwarted the Palestinian Authority's efforts to achieve full diplomatic recognition. This action highlights the ongoing tensions and disputes surrounding the Israeli-Palestinian conflict, with the US siding with Israel in this instance. The veto demonstrates the significant influence and power that the US wields within the UN Security Council, affecting the ability of the Palestinian Authority to advance its statehood aspirations through international channels. The US action further underscores the complex geopolitical dynamics at play in the Middle East and the challenges faced by the Palestinians in their quest for statehood recognition.

Summary:

The United States on Thursday effectively stopped the United Nations from recognizing a Palestinian state by casting a veto in the Security Council to deny the Palestinian Authority full membership of the world body.

item.title: Man in Davao Oriental arrested for beating up his own mother
item.content:encoded:
Man, 33, arrested, Davao Oriental, beating, mother. Summary: A 33-year-old man was arrested in Davao Oriental for beating up his own mother, as reported by GMA Regional TV One Mindanao's "State of the Nation." The incident occurred when the man allegedly physically assaulted his mother during a heated argument, resulting in her sustaining injuries. Authorities were called to the scene, and the man was taken into custody for further investigation and possible charges. This incident highlights the prevalence of domestic violence and the need for intervention and support for victims of such abuse. It is essential to address the underlying issues that lead to such violent behavior and provide resources for families dealing with domestic conflict. The man's actions are a serious criminal offense, and he will likely face legal consequences for his actions. Domestic violence is a serious issue that requires immediate attention and action to ensure the safety and well-being of all individuals involved.

Summary:

A 33-year-old man was arrested in Davao Oriental for beating up his own mother, according to GMA Regional TV One Mindanao's report on "State of the Nation."

item.title: Indonesian volcano eruption forces evacuations, airport closure
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: Indonesia, Ruang volcano, airport closure, evacuation, highest alert Summary: Indonesia closed a provincial airport and evacuated hundreds of people near the Ruang volcano as it emitted explosive plumes of lava, rocks, and ash. The situation prompted officials to declare the highest alert level. The volcano had been erupting for days, posing a significant threat to the surrounding area. The closure of the airport and evacuation of residents were precautionary measures taken to ensure the safety of the people. The eruption caused disruption and concern among local communities, who were advised to stay away from the vicinity of the volcano. The authorities were closely monitoring the situation and providing updates to the public as the volcanic activity continued. The Ruang volcano's eruption serves as a reminder of the unpredictable nature of volcanic events and the importance of being prepared for such emergencies.

Summary:

Indonesia shut a provincial airport and evacuated hundreds of people from the vicinity of the Ruang volcano after it belched explosive plumes of lava, rocks and ash for days, officials said on Thursday, declaring the highest alert on the situation.

item.title: Kenya's military chief among 10 people killed in helicopter crash
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: Kenya, military chief, helicopter crash, General Francis Ogolla, President William Ruto Summary: General Francis Ogolla, Kenya's military chief, tragically lost his life along with 9 others in a military helicopter crash shortly after take-off on Thursday. The crash occurred as the helicopter was leaving the runway. President William Ruto confirmed the deaths of all 10 people on board. The cause of the crash is currently under investigation. The loss of General Ogolla and the other passengers is a devastating blow to the military and the nation of Kenya. The incident highlights the dangers that military personnel face in their line of duty. The nation mourns the loss of these individuals and pays tribute to their service and sacrifice. The investigation into the crash will provide more insight into what caused this tragic accident.

Summary: General Francis Ogolla, Kenya's military chief, was among the 10 people who lost their lives in a military helicopter crash. The crash occurred shortly after take-off, and President William Ruto confirmed the deaths. The cause of the crash is currently being investigated. The incident serves as a reminder of the risks faced by military personnel. The nation mourns the loss of the individuals on board and honors their service.

Kenya's military chief, General Francis Ogolla, was among 10 people killed when their military helicopter crashed shortly after take-off on Thursday, President William Ruto announced.

item.title: Dengue cases surge by nearly 50% in Americas amid 'emergency situation', UN agency says
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: Dengue, emergency situation, Americas, Argentina, Brazil Summary: Dengue cases in the Americas have reached the level of an emergency situation according to the Pan American Health Organization. While cases in hotspots like Argentina and Brazil have stabilized, the overall situation remains critical. The PAHO is closely monitoring the situation and working to contain the spread of the disease. This emphasizes the need for increased awareness and prevention measures to combat the spread of dengue in the region. The organization is calling for continued vigilance and collaboration among countries in the Americas to address this public health crisis.

Summary:

Dengue cases have created an "emergency situation" in the Americas, although cases in hotspots Argentina and Brazil appear to have stabilized, the head of the Pan American Health Organization (PAHO) said on Thursday.

item.title: Philippine inflation remains most urgent concern --OCTA survey
item.content:encoded:
inflation, urgent, national concern, adult Filipinos, first quarter Summary: A majority of adult Filipinos believe that inflation remains the most urgent national concern for the first quarter of 2024. This highlights the ongoing challenge that rising prices pose for the country's economy and the everyday lives of its citizens. The survey reflects the deep impact that inflation has on households and businesses, influencing decision-making and financial planning. It underscores the need for government intervention and effective policies to address this pressing issue and alleviate the burden on the population. The findings signal a sense of unease and uncertainty among the public regarding the economic situation and future prospects. As inflation continues to affect various sectors and aspects of society, it is crucial for policymakers to prioritize solutions that can mitigate its effects and promote stability and growth. The survey results underscore the widespread concern and sense of urgency surrounding inflation and its implications for the country's well-being and development.

Majority of adult Filipinos believe that inflation remains the most urgent national concern for the first quarter of 2024.

item.title: Negosyante na pasakay na kaniyang SUV, patay nang pagbabarilin sa Bacolod City
item.content:encoded:
Negosyante, barilin, convenience store, Bacolod City, patay
Summary: A businessman was fatally shot outside a convenience store in Bacolod City. The incident resulted in his death. The shooting took place in a public area near the store. The authorities are currently investigating the case to determine the motive behind the attack. The victim was identified as a local entrepreneur who was well-known in the community. The tragic incident has shocked residents and raised concerns about safety in the area.

Summary:

Nasawi ang isang negosyante matapos siyang pagbabarilin sa labas ng isang convenience store sa Bacolod City.

item.title: Marcos, Luxon eye review of PH-New Zealand deal on migrant workers
item.content:encoded: The Philippines and New Zealand have agreed to review existing bilateral migrant worker arrangements for a new wave of recruitment for Filipino migrant workers bound for New Zealand.

item.title: Biden to win Kennedy family endorsement amid RFK Jr. presidential bid
item.content:encoded: More than 15 members of the storied Kennedy political family will endorse US President Joe Biden at a Philadelphia campaign event on Thursday in a rebuke of Robert F. Kennedy Jr's independent bid for office.

item.title: China: US missile system in PH worsens tensions in Asia Pacific
item.content:encoded:
expressed, grave concern, US, deployment, medium-range missile system Summary: China has expressed grave concern over the US' recent deployment of a medium-range missile system in the Asia Pacific region. The Chinese government views this move as a threat to regional stability and has urged the US to reconsider its actions. Tensions between the two countries have been escalating in recent years, with issues such as trade disputes, human rights concerns, and territorial disputes in the South China Sea. The deployment of the missile system is seen as a further provocation by China. The US, on the other hand, maintains that the deployment is necessary for regional security and to counter perceived threats from countries like North Korea. The situation remains tense, and both countries are closely monitoring each other's actions in the region.

China has expressed "grave concern" over the US' deployment of a medium-range missile system in the Asia Pacific.

item.title: Earthquake jolts Turkish province of Tokat, AFAD says
item.content:encoded:
Tokat, earthquake, magnitude 5.6, Turkey, AFAD

An earthquake with a magnitude of 5.6 struck the northern Turkish province of Tokat on Thursday, according to the AFAD disaster management authority. The earthquake caused panic and fear among residents as buildings shook, but there have been no immediate reports of casualties or major damage. Authorities are monitoring the situation closely and advising people to take precautions and stay alert. The province of Tokat is known to be prone to seismic activity, and this latest earthquake serves as a reminder of the constant threat that earthquakes pose in the region. Despite the significant magnitude of the earthquake, the quick response and readiness of local authorities have helped in preventing any serious injuries or destruction. The earthquake serves as a wake-up call for residents to be prepared and have emergency plans in place in case of future seismic events.

Summary:

An earthquake with a magnitude of 5.6 shook the northern Turkish province of Tokat on Thursday, Turkey's AFAD disaster management authority said.

item.title: Volunteer firefighter remembered for heroism amid San Juan City blaze
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: volunteer firefighter, tragic loss, bravery, heroism, loved ones Summary: A volunteer firefighter from San Juan City tragically lost his life while responding to a fire incident. His friends and loved ones remembered him for his bravery and heroism. The firefighter selflessly put his life on the line to help others, showing his dedication to serving the community. His actions were a testament to his courage and commitment to his role as a firefighter. The loss was deeply felt by those who knew him, as they remembered him as a hero who made the ultimate sacrifice in the line of duty. The community mourned the loss of a brave and selfless individual who gave everything to protect others. The firefighter's legacy will live on in the hearts of those who were touched by his courage and sacrifice.

Summary: A volunteer firefighter from San Juan City tragically lost his life while responding to a fire incident. His loved ones and friends remembered him for his bravery, heroism, and dedication to serving the community.

The friends and loved ones of the volunteer firefighter who tragically lost his life while responding to a fire incident in San Juan City recalled his bravery and heroism.

item.title: Picture of Gaza grief wins World Press Photo of the Year
item.content:encoded: Reuters photographer Mohammed Salem won the 2024 World Press Photo of the Year award for his image of a Palestinian woman cradling the body of her five-year-old niece in the Gaza Strip.

item.title: Liga ng basketball sa isang bayan ng Occidental Mindoro, P1 milyon ang premyo?

item.content:encoded: A 13-year-old student was fatally shot by a motorcycle-riding gunman while on her way to school in Agoncillo, Batangas.

item.title: Aso na isang buwang na-trap sa pagitan ng mga pader, nasagip sa Cavite
item.content:encoded: Nanghihina man at pumayat, buhay na nailigtas ang isang aso na pinaniniwalaang isang buwan na na-trap sa pagitan ng mga pader matapos na iwan ng dati niyang mga amo sa Cavite City.

item.title: Bureau of Immigration nabs 2 suspected Chinese fugitives
item.content:encoded: A Chinese fugitive wanted for his alleged involvement in a Philippines Offshore Gaming Operator (POGO) scam hub in Las Piñas City in July 2023 was nabbed by the Bureau of Immigration (BI) in Mandaue City, Cebu. In Mindoro, a Chinese national was arrested for suspected credit card fraud.

item.title: No reason to cast doubt after shabu haul total revised, say authorities
item.content:encoded: Authorities on Monday pushed back on any skepticism after the size and value of a publicized drug haul was reduced, saying they went through the correct process.

item.content:encoded: There were no winners of either of the big lotto draws held on Thursday, April 18, 2024, according to the Philippine Charity Sweepstakes Office (PCSO).

item.content:encoded: President Ferdinand "Bongbong" Marcos Jr. and visiting New Zealand Prime Minister Christopher Luxon jointly expressed “serious concern” regarding heightening tensions in the South China Sea.

item.title: US deploys midrange missile system in PH amid joint military exercise
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: US forces, Mid-Range Capability missile system, Northern Luzon, joint military exercises, Philippine troops Summary: US forces have deployed their Mid-Range Capability missile system (MRCS) in Northern Luzon for joint military exercises with Philippine troops. The MRCS is designed to enhance the military capabilities and readiness of both countries. The troops will engage in a series of training exercises to improve coordination and interoperability between the two forces. The joint exercises aim to strengthen the defense capabilities of the Philippines and demonstrate the strong military partnership between the US and the Philippines. The deployment of the MRCS in Northern Luzon underscores the commitment of both countries to ensuring regional security and stability.

Summary:

US forces deployed its Mid-Range Capability missile system (MRCS) in Northern Luzon as part of joint military exercises with Philippine troops.

item.title: Knife-carrying 'most wanted" US fugitive nabbed in St. Peter"s Square
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: Italian police, arrested, US fugitive, knives, Vatican
Summary: Italian police arrested a "most wanted" US fugitive last week in St Peter's Square outside the Vatican. The fugitive was found to be carrying three concealed knives at the time of his arrest. The arrest took place in a crowded area, raising concerns about potential harm that could have been caused. The fugitive is now in custody awaiting further legal proceedings. This incident highlights the importance of vigilance and prompt action by law enforcement in ensuring public safety and apprehending wanted individuals.
Summary:

Italian police arrested a "most wanted" US fugitive last week who was carrying three concealed knives in a crowded St Peter's Square outside the Vatican, a judicial source said on Thursday.

item.title: Dubai Airport will return to full operational capacity within 24 hours, COO says
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: Dubai International Airport, operational capacity, 24 hours, Dubai Airports, chief operating officer Summary:

Dubai International Airport is expected to be fully operational within the next 24 hours, according to Majed Al Joker, the chief operating officer of Dubai Airports. This announcement comes after a temporary disruption in services at the airport. Al Joker confirmed that all necessary measures are being taken to ensure the airport returns to normal operations quickly. The airport plays a crucial role in connecting Dubai to the rest of the world and is a key hub for both passengers and cargo. The rapid resolution of any issues at the airport is essential for maintaining smooth and efficient air travel. With Al Joker's reassurance, passengers can be confident that the airport will resume its full operational capacity shortly, allowing them to continue their travel plans without disruption.

Summary:

Dubai International Airport will return to its full operational capacity within 24 hours, Dubai Airports chief operating officer Majed Al Joker told state news agency WAM on Thursday.

item.title: Special investigation team formed for slain Kidapawan broadcaster
item.content:encoded: Justice Secretary Jesus Crispin Remulla has ordered the creation of a special investigation team to probe the July 2019 killing of broadcaster Eduardo Dizon in North Cotabato.

item.title: FL Liza Marcos, sinabing 'bad shot' sa kaniya si VP Sara Duterte
item.content:encoded: Hindi ikinaila ni First Lady Liza Araneta-Marcos ang sama ng loob kay Vice President Sara Duterte dahil sa pag-akusa ng ama ng huli na gumagamit ng ilegal na droga si Pangulong President Ferdinand “Bongbong” Marcos Jr.

item.title: DMW: 3 OFWs, nasawi nang maganap ang matinding pagbaha sa UAE
item.content:encoded: Nakumpirma na ng Department of Migrant Workers (DMW) na mayroong tatlong overseas Filipino workers ang nasawi nang nangyari ang matinding pagbaha sa United Arab Emirates.

item.title: Human rights group urge surfacing of missing labor organizer in Bukidnon
item.content:encoded:
rights group, surfacing, veteran labor organizer, abducted, military Summary: A human rights group is calling for the surfacing of a veteran labor organizer who was allegedly abducted by the military in Quezon, Bukidnon. The incident occurred a week ago, and concerns have been raised about the safety and well-being of the organizer. The group is urging authorities to investigate the disappearance and ensure the organizer's safe return. The abduction highlights the ongoing risks faced by labor activists and organizers in the region. It also underscores the importance of upholding human rights and protecting individuals who are fighting for workers' rights. The group's call for action is a reminder of the need for accountability and justice in cases of human rights violations.

A human rights" group on Thursday called for the surfacing of a veteran labor organizer who was allegedly abducted by the military a week ago in the municipality of Quezon in Bukidnon.

item.title: Sekyu, patay matapos barilin ng mga kawatan sa Misamis Oriental
item.content:encoded:
security guard, kasamahan, barilin, kawatan, planta Patay ang isang security guard at sugatan ang isa pa matapos silang barilin ng mga kawatan sa Villanueva, Misamis Oriental. Ang insidente ay nangyari sa isang planta ng bakal na kanilang binabantayan. Ang isang security guard ay namatay habang ang kanyang kasamahan ay natanggap ang sugat. Ang mga kawatan ay nanloob sa planta ng bakal at walang awa silang pinagbabaril ang mga security guard. Ang mga biktima ay agad na dinala sa ospital upang agarang mabigyan ng lunas ang kanilang mga sugat. Ang insidente ay nagdulot ng takot at pangamba sa komunidad at inaasahang imbestigasyon ang isasagawa upang mabigyang hustisya ang mga biktima ng krimen.

Summary: Patay ang isang security guard at sugatan ang isa pa matapos barilin ng mga kawatan sa planta ng bakal sa Villanueva, Misamis Oriental. Ang insidente ay nagdulot ng takot sa komunidad at isang imbestigasyon ang inaasahang isasagawa upang mabigyan ng hustisya ang mga biktima.

Patay ang isang security guard, habang sugatan ang isa pa niyang kasamahan, matapos silang barilin ng mga kawatan na nanloob sa binabantayan nilang planta ng bakal sa Villanueva, Misamis Oriental.

item.title: Rights violations victims react to Marcos on apology, ill-gotten wealth
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: victim, human rights violations, Martial Law, justice, apology Summary: One victim of human rights violations during Martial Law expressed a preference for justice over an apology. The victim, along with others who suffered under the oppressive regime, believed that holding accountable those responsible for the violations was crucial for closure and healing. The demand for justice was emphasized as a way to acknowledge the harm done and prevent such atrocities from happening again in the future. The victims highlighted the importance of accountability as a means to address the lingering trauma and scars left by the era of Martial Law. Through seeking justice, the victims aimed to bring about a sense of closure and empower others to speak out against injustices perpetrated by those in power.

Summary:

One of the victims of human rights violations said those who suffered under Martial Law preferred justice over an apology.

item.title: CHED open to probe influx of Chinese students in Cagayan
item.content:encoded: Following concerns raised by some sectors, the Commission on Higher Education (CHED) said it will support any investigation on the alleged influx of Chinese students in Cagayan.

item.title: Liza Marcos on VP Sara: 'Bad shot na 'yan sa "kin"
item.content:encoded: First Lady Liza Araneta-Marcos has admitted having ill feelings towards Vice President Sara Duterte after the latter"s family made drug accusations against President Ferdinand “Bongbong” Marcos Jr.

item.content:encoded: A graduate of the Matias H. Aznar Memorial College of Medicine has topped the medical board examinations given in April 2024.

item.content:encoded: Nakumpirma na ng Department of Migrant Workers (DMW) na mayroong tatlong overseas Filipino workers ang nasawi nang nangyari ang matinding pagbaha sa United Arab Emirates.

item.content:encoded: The Supreme Court has reiterated that the law on violence against women and their children (VAWC) also applies to lesbian relationships.

item.title: QC to host 23rd Tour of the Fireflies on April 21
item.content:encoded: The Quezon City local government on Thursday advised the public to expect traffic ahead of the 23rd Tour of the Fireflies bike event on Sunday morning, on April 21, 2024.

item.title: Cat clings to car door handle to escape Dubai flood

item.title: GSIS earmarks P2.5B for emergency loans in Cavite, Mindoro
item.content:encoded: The Government Service Insurance System (GSIS) on Thursday said it has allocated some P2.5 billion for emergency loans for members and pensioners affected by the pertussis outbreak in Cavite, and the El Niño phenomenon in Occidental Mindoro.
